The '''intention economy''' is an approach to viewing [[markets]] and [[economies]] focusing on buyers as a [[scarcity|scarce]] commodity. The consumers' intent to buy drives the production of goods to meet their specific needs. It is also the title of [[Doc Searls]] book: ''[[The Intention Economy: When Customers Take Charge]]'' published in May, 2012. ==Concept== [[Doc Searls]] coined the term in an article for [[Linux Journal]]. He wrote:
"The Intention Economy grows around buyers, not sellers. It leverages the simple fact that buyers are the first source of money, and that they come ready-made. You don't need advertising to make them."{{cite news | first=Doc | last=Searls | coauthors= | title=The Intention Economy | date=2006-03-08 | publisher= | url =http://www.linuxjournal.com/node/1000035 | work =Linux Journal | pages = | accessdate = 2007-09-28 | language = }} Despite the advancement of the internet businesses are still seller oriented. Even successful businesses like [[Google]] still have the point of view of the sellers, with their revenue coming nearly all from advertising. Searls describes the current condition as a series of silos. The only option a buyer has is merely moving from silo to silo. Nothing has fundamentally changed.''idem'' Some sites have similar characteristics of an intention economy. For example, flight booking services [[Priceline.com]], which let users name their price for an airline ticket still functions like a "silo." In an intention economy a site like Priceline might serve as an intermediary with the airline coordinating new flight dates and times that correspond around the buyers intentions. Companies need to be able to respond to a customer's precise needs. "[[Mass customization]], in a lot of areas it is no longer inherently necessary that I get the exact same thing as a million other people. A computer manufacturer can be geared for assembling a computer just for me, to my specifications. A travel agency can construct a travel plan particularly for me."{{cite news | first= | last= | coauthors= | title=Crowd Clout | date=April 2007 | publisher= | url =http://www.trendwatching.com/trends/crowdclout.htm | work =[[Trendwatching.com]] | pages = | accessdate = 2007-09-28 | language = }} ==Examples== Searls gives an example of intention economy scenario: "A car rental customer should be able to say to the car rental market, 'I'll be skiing in Park City from March 20–25. I want to rent a 4-wheel drive SUV. I belong to Avis Wizard, Budget FastBreak and Hertz 1 Club. I don't want to pay up front for gas or get any insurance. What can any of you companies do for me?' — and have the sellers compete for the buyer's business." [[Jody Turner|Trendwatching.com]] describes two problems with intention economy sites. "...Most of these ‘information brokers’ focus on only one product/category. Many of them also work (too) closely with a limited set of suppliers. Sites that seem to act like intention economy sites are not. For example, [[Priceline.com|Priceline]] which lets customers name their own price and then matches it with the (pre-set) minimum prices that airlines, hotels and rental car companies have provided [[Priceline.com]] with this space remains wide open for intention-brokers who can handle a variety of intentions per customer, and genuinely operate on behalf of those customers." {{Citation needed|date=July 2008}} [[Trendwatching]] lists examples of intention economy sites currently online: *[[Igglo]] lets potential buyers bid on houses that aren't on the market. *[[Zillow]] lets home owners name their "Make Me Move" before putting their house on the market. *[[Eventful]] allows users to collectively persuade performers to come to their town. *[[SellaBand]] allows users to collectively sponsor and help manage a band for a cut of the revenue. *[http://www.kleemi.com Kleemi] allows members to create list of intentions that friends and vendors can; comment, review, or make offers on. *[[Infinite Buyer]] allows registered consumers to make their offer on seller listings; benefit to consumers is that they can buy what they want (relevant), at their price (personal), when they need it (efficient) *[http://intently.co Intently.co] allows users to request any service anywhere. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{cite web |last=Roberts |first=Russ |title=Searls on the Intention Economy |url=http://www.econtalk.org/archives/_featuring/doc_searls/ |work=[[EconTalk]] |publisher=[[Library of Economics and Liberty]] |authorlink=Russ Roberts |date=March 11, 2013}} [[Category:Economic systems]] [[Category:E-commerce]]

{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = | name = Kongara Jaggayya | image = | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1926|12|31}} | birth_place = [[Tenali]], [[Guntur district]],
[[Madras Presidency]], British India | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|2004|03|05|1926|12|31}} | death_place = [[Chennai]], Tamil Nadu, India | occupation = Actor, dubbing artist, littérateur, journalist, poet, politician | awards = [[Padma Bhushan]] 1992 | spouse = | alma mater =[[Andhra Christian College]] | birthname = | othername = Kalavachaspati
Kanchu Kantham
Super star }} '''Kongara Jaggayya''' (31 December 1926 – 5 August 2004) was an [[Indian film]] actor, littérateur, journalist, lyricist, dubbing artist and politician known for his works predominantly in [[Telugu cinema]] and [[Telugu theatre]].{{cite web|url=https://26lettersto24frames.wordpress.com/2011/12/12/kalaa-vachaspati-kanchu-kantham-kongara-jaggayya/|title="Kalaa Vachaspati", "Kanchu Kantham": Kongara Jaggayya|first=|last=krshychait|date=12 December 2011|publisher=}} Regarded as one of the finest [[method actor]]s of Indian cinema,{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/2004/03/06/stories/2004030602830600.htm|title=The Hindu : Jaggayya passes away|website=www.thehindu.com}} he was known as ''Kanchu Kantham Jaggayya'' ([[Telugu language|Telugu]]) for his booming voice. In a film career spanning forty years as a [[matinee idol]], he starred in eighty films, as a lead actor, and lead antagonist in a variety of genres. During his early career he portrayed breakthrough characters in works such as ''[[Donga Ramudu]]'' (1955), which was archived by the Film and Television Institute of India, He starred in award winning works such as ''[[Bangaru Papa]]'' (1954), ''[[Ardhangi]]'' (1955), ''[[Edi Nijam]]'' (1956), ''[[Todi Kodallu]]'' (1957), ''[[Doctor Chakravarty|Dr. Chakravarti]]'' (1964), ''[[Antastulu]]'' (1965), the [[Cannes Film Festival]] featured ''[[Meghasandesam]]'' (1982), and [[Seethakoka Chiluka (1981 film)|Seethakoka Chiluka]] (1981); all of which won the [[National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Telugu|National Film Award for Best Feature Films in Telugu]]. In 1962, he co-produced and starred in the political drama film ''[[Padandi Munduku]]'' based on [[Salt March]], the film was screened at the [[International Film Festival of India]], the Tashkent Film Festival, and got a special mention at the 5th [[Moscow International Film Festival]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chitramala.com/articles/tollywood-4063.html|title=Tollywood's Glorious Journey at Chitramala.|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100130192602/http://www.chitramala.com/articles/tollywood-4063.html|archivedate=30 January 2010|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://www.idlebrain.com/news/2000march20/profile-gummadi.html|title=Profile of Gummadi - Telugu film actor|publisher=}} As a [[character actor]] he received critical appreciation for his performance in notable works such as ''[[Velugu Needalu]]'' (1961), ''[[Chitti Tammudu]]'' (1962), ''[[Aradhana (1962 film)|Aaradhana]]'' (1962), ''[[Aathma Balam|Aatma Balam]]'' (1964), ''[[Sumangali (1965 film)|Sumangali]]'' (1965), ''[[Gudi Gantalu]]'' (1965), ''[[Navaratri (1966 film)|Nava ratri]]'' (1966), ''[[Aame Evaru? (1966 film)|Aame Evaru?]]'' (1966), ''[[Aastiparulu]]'' (1966), ''Jarigina Katha'' (1969), ''[[Bala Mitrula Katha]]'' (1972), ''[[Badi Pantulu]]'' (1972), ''[[Devudu Chesina Manushulu]]'' (1973). He portrayed British official Rutherford in the biographical film ''[[Alluri Seetarama Raju (film)|Alluri Sita Rama Raju]]'' (1974), and essayed [[Pontius Pilate]] in the hagiographical film ''[[Karunamayudu]]'' (1978). He then appeared in works such as ''[[Veta (film)|Veta]]'' (1986), ''[[Chantabbai]]'' (1986), ''[[Pasivadi Pranam]]'' (1987), and ''[[Dharma Kshetram]]'' (1992). He has won the Andhra Pradesh state [[Nandi Award for Best Character Actor]] for his works in some of these films. A recipient of the [[Tamil Nadu]] state's [[Kalaimamani]], the Government of India has honored him with the [[Padma Bhushan]] in 1992 for his contributions towards [[Indian cinema]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hindu.com/2004/03/06/stories/2004030602830600.htm|title=Jaggayya passes away|first=By Our Special|last=Correspondent|date=3 May 2004|publisher=|pages=06|via=The Hindu (old)}} == Early life == Jaggayya was born to Kongara Seetaramaih and Rajya Lakshmamma. He was born in a well-to-do family in Morampudi village near [[Tenali]] in [[Guntur district]]. He quoted on several occasions in his essays the influence his father had on his interest towards arts. He started acting at the age of 11, with the role of [[Lava (Ramayana)|Lava]] in a [[Hindi]] play during his high school days in [[Duggirala]]. He got trained in the art of painting under the guidance of [[Adivi Bapiraju]], a noted painter, during his college days. As a student, he joined the [[Congress Socialist Party|Congress Socialist party]] in Tenali, which was involved in the [[Indian Independence Movement]] at that time. He joined the [[Andhra-Christian College]], in 1942, in [[Guntur]] for his higher studies. He used to be a member of Navya Sahitya Parishath in Guntur. Later he joined a periodical named ''Desabhimani'' (meaning "Patriot") as a journalist.http://www.filmchamber.com/tmpl.asp?it=prfbjagayaLater he worked as an editor for the weekly Andhra Republic. During his B.A. days in A-C College, he along with [[N. T. Rama Rao]], acted in several plays. He also used to be a part of Navajyothi Artists, a cultural organisation run by [[Mukkamala]]. After working as a teacher in Duggirala for a brief while, he became a news announcer in [[All India Radio|Akashavani]] for three years.telugucinema.com/c/stars/KJaggayya.shtmlJaggayya won the best actor award in three successive years for ''Chesina Papam'' and ''Telangana''. == Film career == He made his cinematic debut in 1952 drama film ''Priyuralu'' directed by [[Tripuraneni Gopichand]].{{cite web|url=http://www.apherald.com/Movies/ViewArticle/3671|title=Rutherford of Telugu cinema|publisher=}} This movie was produced by Donepudi Krishnamurthy, also known popularly as Gokul Krishnamurthy. He quit the job as news announcer as he signed three movies on a trot. His second movie, ''Adarsham,'' didn't do well at box office. His planned third movie ''Paleru'' did not even see light of the day. ''[[Bangaru Papa]],'' directed by [[Bommireddy Narasimha Reddy|B N Reddy]], released in 1955, was the first breakthrough film for Jaggayya. He was distinguished for his booming voice and contributed as a voice artist for more than hundred feature films. He dubbed in Telugu language for veteran [[Sivaji Ganesan]]. He was the narrator, and dubbing artist for internationally recognized works such as [[Maa Bhoomi]], and [[Richard Attenborough]]'s character of John Hammond in the Telugu-dubbed version of the Hollywood film ''[[Jurassic Park (film)|Jurassic Park]]''. He acted in almost 100 films as a lead, 100 more as a co-lead and almost 200 films as a character artist. He was a part of almost every film of [[V. B. Rajendra Prasad|VB Rajendra Parasad]]'s ''Jagapathi Pictures,'' [[K. B. Tilak|K B Tilak]]'s ''Anupama Pictures'' and ''Ramavijeta Films'' owned by brothers Prabhakar and Baburao. His last film as an actor was ''Kunthi Putrudu,'' which starred [[Mohan Babu]] as lead and was directed by [[Dasari Narayana Rao]]. He turned into producer with a film ''[[Padandi Munduku]],'' under the banner of ''Jagruthi Chitra.'' The film was released in January 1962 and was a regarded as first Telugu social film made on the basis of Indian Independence movement. He was awarded the 'Kala Vachaspathi' for his sonorous voice.earlytollywood.blogspot.in/2008/02/kongara-jaggaiah.html == Political career == Jaggayya was active in politics right from his student days and was allied with the socialist group within the Congress party. When the group was disbanded, he joined [[Jayaprakash Narayan]]'s [[Praja Socialist Party]], but returned to Congress in 1956, heeding the call of [[Jawaharlal Nehru]]. In 1967, he was elected as a member of the fourth [[Lok Sabha]], the lower house of the [[Parliament of India]] from the constituency of [[Ongole]] on a Congress Party ticket. He was the first Indian film actor to be elected as a member of parliament.tollywood.info/actor/k/kongara_jaggayya.htm == Literary achievements == He translated Nobel laureate [[Rabindranath Tagore]]'s [[Geetanjali]] and multiple poems into Telugu under the name ''Ravindra Geetha''. He also translated Tagore's play "Sacrifice" into Telugu under the name ''Balidaanam''. He also co-founded ''Manasvini Charitable Trust'' to honor the film literature of ''[[Aatreya (playwright)|Acharya Athreya]].'' The lyrics of all the film songs written by Athreya was consolidated into seven volumes. == Awards == ;Civilian honours * [[Padma Bhushan]], [[Government of India]] in 1992 ;Nandi Awards *[[Nandi Award for Best Character Actor]] ;State Awards *Andhra Pradesh Government cash award for producing ''[[Padandi Munduku]]'' in 1962 * Title of ''[[Kalaimamani]]'' from [[Tamil Nadu]] government ;Other honours * Title of ''Kala Vachaspathi'' from the ''[[Sanskrit]] Viswa Vidyalaya'', [[Delhi]] * Title of ''[[Kala Prapoorna]]'' from [[Andhra University]], [[Visakhapatnam]] * Honorary D. {{Infobox judge | honorific-prefix = | name = John L. Kane Jr. | honorific-suffix = | image = | alt = | caption = | office = [[Senior status|Senior Judge]] of the [[United States District Court for the District of Colorado]] | term_start = April 8, 1988 | term_end = | office1 = Judge of the [[United States District Court for the District of Colorado]] | term_start1 = December 16, 1977 | term_end1 = April 8, 1988 | nominator1 = | appointer1 = [[List of federal judges appointed by Jimmy Carter|Jimmy Carter]] | predecessor1 = [[Alfred Albert Arraj]] | successor1 = [[Lewis Thornton Babcock]] | pronunciation = | birth_name = John Lawrence Kane Jr.''The American Bench: Judges of the Nation.'' (1997) Edited by Ruth A. Kennedy. Forster-Long. | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1937|2|14}} | birth_place = [[Tucumcari, New Mexico|Tucumcari]], [[New Mexico]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | citizenship = | nationality = | party = | otherparty = | height = | spouse = | partner = | relations = | children = | parents = | mother = | father = | relatives = | residence = | education = [[University of Colorado Boulder]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]])
[[Sturm College of Law]] ([[Juris Doctor|J.D.]]) | alma_mater = | occupation = | profession = | known_for = | salary = | net_worth = | cabinet = | committees = | portfolio = | religion = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | footnotes = }} '''John Lawrence Kane Jr.''' (born February 14, 1937) is a [[Senior Status|Senior]] [[United States federal judge|United States District Judge]] of the [[United States District Court for the District of Colorado]]. ==Education and career== Born in [[Tucumcari, New Mexico|Tucumcari]], [[New Mexico]], Kane received a [[Bachelor of Arts]] degree from the [[University of Colorado Boulder]] in 1958 and a [[Juris Doctor]] from the [[Sturm College of Law]] at the [[University of Denver]] in 1960. He was a [[law clerk]] for the Seventeenth Judicial District of Colorado from 1960 to 1961. He worked in private practice in [[Brighton, Colorado|Brighton]], [[Colorado]] from 1961 to 1963. He was a deputy district attorney of the Seventeenth Judicial District of Colorado from 1961 to 1963. He was in private practice in [[Denver]], Colorado in 1964. He was the public defender of [[Adams County, Colorado|Adams County]] in Brighton, Colorado from 1965 to 1967. He was the Deputy Director of the [[Peace Corps]] in the Eastern Region of India in [[Kolkata|Calcutta]] (now Kolkata), [[India]] from 1967 to 1968. He was a Country Representative of the Peace Corps in [[Turkey]] from 1968 to 1969. He was an Instructor at [[Metropolitan State University of Denver]] from 1973 to 1974. He was in private practice in Denver from 1970 to 1977. He was an adjunct professor at Sturm College of Law from 1978 to 1988. He was a visiting lecturer in law at [[Trinity College, Dublin|Trinity College]] in [[Dublin]], [[Ireland]] in 1989. He was the Miller Distinguished Visiting Professor of Law at Sturm College of Law from 1990 to 1996. He was an adjunct professor at the [[University of Colorado Law School]] from 1996 to present. ==Federal judicial service== Kane was nominated by President [[Jimmy Carter]] on November 2, 1977, to a seat on the [[United States District Court for the District of Colorado]] vacated by Judge [[Alfred Albert Arraj]]. He was confirmed by the [[United States Senate]] on December 15, 1977, and received his commission on December 16, 1977. He assumed [[senior status]] due to a certified disability on April 8, 1988.{{cite web|url=https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/appellate-courts/F3/43/1446/553259/|title=John L. Kane, Jr., Plaintiff-appellant, v. the United States, Defendant-appellee, 43 F.3d 1446 (Fed. Cir. 1994)|publisher=}} His disability was [[sleep apnea]], brought about by work related stress. Despite being granted early senior status, he has continued to work a reduced, but substantial caseload to the present. ==Personal== Kane was interviewed by his daughter as part of [[StoryCorps]] on [[NPR]]'s ''[[Morning Edition]]'' on October 8, 2010.http://media.storycorps.org/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/listen/audio/kane.mp3 {{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Sources== * {{FJC Bio|1224|nid=1383051|name=John L. Kane Jr.}} * [http://www.cod.uscourts.gov/JudicialOfficers/SeniorArticleIIIJudges/HonJohnLKane.aspx Hon. John L. Kane] [http://www.cod.uscourts.gov District of Colorado] {{s-start}} {{s-legal}} {{s-bef|before=[[Alfred Albert Arraj]]}} {{s-ttl|title={{nowrap|Judge of the [[United States District Court for the District of Colorado]]}}|years=1977–1988}} {{s-aft|after=[[Lewis Thornton Babcock]]}} {{s-end}} {{United States 10th Circuit senior district judges}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kane, John L. }} {{Infobox Korean name |title = '''Kim Jong-un''' or '''Kim Jong Un''' |image = Kim Jong-un (Korean and Chinese characters).svg |image_size = 160px |caption = "Kim Jong-un" in [[Hangeul|Chosŏn'gŭl]] (top) and [[Hanja|hancha]] (bottom) scripts. |context = north |hangul = {{linktext|김|정|은}} |hanja = {{lang|ko|{{linktext|金|正|恩}}}}{{cite web |url=https://web.archive.org/liveweb/http://news.naver.com/main/hotissue/read.nhn?mid=hot&sid1=100&gid=438117&cid=565935&iid=259968&oid=020&aid=0002171110&ptype=011 |script-title=ko:[北 막오른 김정은 시대]조선중앙통신 보도, 金正銀(Ｘ) 金正恩 |publisher=[[Naver]] |date=2 October 2010 |accessdate=2 December 2010 |language=ko}} |rr = Gim Jeong(-)eun |mr = Kim Chŏngŭn }} '''Kim Jong-un''' (officially [[Transcription (linguistics)|transcribed]] '''Kim Jong Un'''; {{Korean|hangul=김정은|context=north}}; {{IPA-ko|kim.dzɔŋ.ɯn}};{{efn|The given name ''Jong-un'' / ''Jong Un'' is pronounced {{IPA-ko|tsɔŋ.ɯn}} in isolation.}} born 8 January 1983) is a [[North Korea]]n politician serving as [[Supreme Leader of North Korea]] since 2011 and [[Leader of the Workers' Party of Korea|Leader]] of the [[Workers' Party of Korea]] since 2012. Kim is the second child of [[Kim Jong-il]] (1941–2011) and [[Ko Yong-hui]] (1952–2004).Moore, Malcolm. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/5428300/Kim-Jong-un-a-profile-of-North-Koreas-next-leader.html Kim Jong-un: a profile of North Korea's next leader] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090605153019/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/5428300/Kim-Jong-un-a-profile-of-North-Koreas-next-leader.html |date=5 June 2009 }}. ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]''. 2 June 2009 The grandson of [[Kim Il-sung]], the first leader of North Korea from 1948 to [[Death and state funeral of Kim Il-sung|1994]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dailynk.com/korean/read.php?cataId=nk00500&num=55181 |script-title=ko:김일성, 쿠바의 '혁명영웅' 체게바라를 만난 날 |language=Korean |date=15 April 2008 |work=DailyNK |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110429064851/http://www.dailynk.com/korean/read.php?cataId=nk00500&num=55181 |archivedate=29 April 2011 }} he is the first North Korean leader to have been born after the [[History of North Korea|country's founding]].{{cite news|last1=News |first1=World |title=Who is North Korea's secretive Kim Jong Un? Here is what we know |url=http://worldnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/04/05/17601453-who-is-north-koreas-secretive-kim-jong-un-here-is-what-we-know |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160827133615/http://worldnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/04/05/17601453-who-is-north-koreas-secretive-kim-jong-un-here-is-what-we-know |archive-date=27 August 2016 |publisher=NBC News |date=5 April 2013 |deadurl=yes |df= }} From late 2010, Kim Jong-un was viewed as [[heir apparent]] to the leadership of the DPRK, and following [[Death and state funeral of Kim Jong-il|the elder Kim's death]], he was announced as the "Great Successor" by North Korean state television.{{cite news |url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052970204791104577107350219610874.html |title=Kim Jong Il Has Died |date=18 December 2011 |accessdate=19 December 2011 |author=Alastair Gale |publisher=[[The Wall Street Journal Asia]]}} Kim holds the titles of Chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (as [[General Secretary of the Communist Party|First Secretary]] between 2012 and 2016), Chairman of the [[Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea|Central Military Commission]], [[Chairman of the State Affairs Commission]], [[Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army]],{{cite news|title=N.Korea declares Kim Jong-Un commander of military |url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jJYCeXinUm40ybUlJzb4_aOAiSAQ?docId=CNG.abd2d9a288a1831892829dfc484f077e.6a1 |accessdate=30 December 2011 |agency=Agence France-Presse |date=30 December 2011 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 February 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140224223520/http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jJYCeXinUm40ybUlJzb4_aOAiSAQ?docId=CNG.abd2d9a288a1831892829dfc484f077e.6a1 |df= }} and member of the [[Presidium of the Politburo of the Workers' Party of Korea|Presidium]] of the [[Politburo of the Workers' Party of Korea|Politburo]] of the Workers' Party of Korea, the highest decision-making body in North Korea.[https://web.archive.org/web/20120114235905/http://ca.news.yahoo.com/kim-son-declared-supreme-leader-nkoreas-people-party-074210556.html North Korea tells rival SKorea and other nations not to expect any change, despite new leader]. The Associated Press (via Yahoo! News). 29 December 2011. Retrieved 1 January 2012. Kim was promoted to the rank of [[Wonsu|Marshal]] of North Korea in the [[Korean People's Army]] on 18 July 2012, consolidating his position as the Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces{{cite news|title=North Korea's Kim Jong-un named 'marshal' |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18881524 |accessdate=18 July 2012 |publisher=BBC News |date=18 July 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120718074405/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18881524 |archivedate=18 July 2012 }} and is often referred to as Marshal Kim Jong-un or "the Marshal" by state media.{{cite news|title=North Korean leader orders to turn armed forces into elite revolutionary army |url=http://tass.ru/en/world/764640 |accessdate=28 December 2014 |agency=Information Telegraph Agency of Russia |date=2 December 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150704075153/http://tass.ru/en/world/764640 |archive-date= 4 July 2015 |dead-url=no |df= }}
{{cite news|title=Kim Jong-un's latest no-show fuels further health rumours |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/oct/10/kim-jong-un-north-korea-health-rumours |accessdate=28 December 2014 |work=The Guardian |issn=0261-3077 |location=London, UK |date=10 October 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141213222457/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/oct/10/kim-jong-un-north-korea-health-rumours |archivedate=13 December 2014 }} Kim obtained two degrees, one in physics at [[Kim Il-sung University]], and another as an Army officer at the [[Kim Il-sung Military University]].{{cite news|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/world_now/2011/12/kim-jong-un-first-appearance.html|title=Kim Jong Un makes first appearance since father's death|publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=20 December 2011|accessdate=8 January 2012}}{{cite web|last=Powell |first=Bill |date=22 December 2011 |url=http://content.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,2102985,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702154036/http://content.time.com/time/world/article/0%2C8599%2C2102985%2C00.html |dead-url=no |archivedate= 2 July 2015 |title=The Generals Who Will Really Rule North Korea |work=Time |location=New York |issn=0040-781X |df= }} ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine ranked Kim the [[Forbes list of The World's Most Powerful People|46th most powerful person in the world]] in 2013 and the third highest amongst [[Koreans]] after [[Ban Ki-moon]] and [[Lee Kun-hee]].{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/lmh45kjle/no-46-kim-jong-un/|title=No. 46: Kim Jong Un - pg.48|first=Caroline|last=Howard|website=Forbes}} On 12 December 2013, North Korean news outlets reported that Kim Jong-un had ordered the execution of his uncle [[Jang Song-thaek]] due to "treachery".{{cite news|first=JH|last=Ahn|url=https://www.nknews.org/2016/08/kim-jong-uns-executed-uncle-jang-song-thaek-reappears-on-n-korean-media/|title=Kim Jong Un's executed uncle Jang Song Thaek reappears on N.Korean media|publisher=NKNews|date=10 August 2016|accessdate=23 January 2018}} On 9 March 2014, Kim was elected unopposed to the [[Supreme People's Assembly]]. He is widely believed to have ordered the assassination of his half-brother, [[Kim Jong-nam]], in Malaysia in February 2017.[https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/15/world/asia/kim-jong-nam-dna-malaysia.html DNA Confirms Assassination Victim Was Half Brother of Kim Jong-un, Malaysia Says] New York Times. By Russell Goldman. 5 March 2017. Downloaded 6 May 2017.[http://m.koreatimes.co.kr/phone/news/view.jsp?req_newsidx=224020 Kim Jong-un risks vital ties with China] Korea Times. By Jun Ji-hye. 16 February 2017. Downloaded 6 May 2017. Despite [[North Korea–South Korea relations|tense relations]], North Korea agreed to [[North Korea at the 2018 Winter Olympics|participate]] in the [[2018 Winter Olympics]] in [[Pyeongchang]]. Following the Olympics, Kim Jong-un and [[President of South Korea|President]] [[Moon Jae-in]] conducted the [[April 2018 inter-Korean summit]]. It was the first time since the end of the [[Korean War]] in 1953 that a North Korean leader entered the South's territory. On 12 June 2018, Kim Jong-un and [[President of the United States|US President]] [[Donald Trump]] met for the [[2018 North Korea–United States summit]] in [[Singapore]], the first-ever talks held between a North Korean leader and a sitting US President, to discuss the [[North Korea and weapons of mass destruction|North Korean nuclear program]]. == Early life== [[File:Schule Liebefeld-Steinhölzli, Köniz.jpg|thumb|left|The Liebefeld-Steinhölzli public school in [[Köniz]], [[Switzerland]], which Kim Jong-un is reported to have attended.]] Scarce information on Kim Jong-un's early life comes from [[North Korean defectors]] and people who have claimed to witness him abroad, such as during his school attendance in [[Switzerland]]. Some of the information has been conflicting and contradictory, perhaps confusing him with his brother, [[Kim Jong-chul]], who also attended school in Switzerland around the same time. North Korean authorities and state-run media have stated that Kim's birthdate was 8 January 1982,{{cite news |title=Everything you need to know about North Korean leader Kim Jong Un |url=https://abcnews.go.com/International/north-korean-leader-kim-jong/story?id=46804057 |accessdate=2018-06-15 |work=ABC News }} but South Korean intelligence officials believe the actual date is a year later. It is thought that Kim's official birth year was changed for symbolic reasons; 1982 marks 70 years after the birth of his grandfather, [[Kim Il-sung]], and 40 years after the official birth of his father [[Kim Jong-il]]. The [[US Treasury Department]] lists Kim Jong-un's official birthdate as 8 January 1984.{{cite news |last1=Szoldra |first1=Paul |last2=Bondranenko |first2=Veronika |title=How North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, 33, became one of the world's scariest dictators |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/how-north-korean-leader-kim-jong-un-33-became-one-of-the-worlds-scariest-dictators-a7691396.html |accessdate=2018-06-15 |work=The Independent |date=2017-04-19}} Former basketball star [[Dennis Rodman]] said that this was Kim's birthdate after meeting in September 2013 in North Korea. Kim Jong-Un was the second of three children [[Ko Yong-hui]] bore to Kim Jong-il; his elder brother Kim Jong-chul was born in 1981, while his younger sister, [[Kim Yo-jong]], is believed to have been born in 1987.{{cite news|title=Kim Jong-un's sister is having a ball |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2957573 |archive-date=16 October 2015 |work=Korea JoongAng Daily |date=8 August 2012 |last1=Lee |first1=Young-jong |last2=Kim |first2=Hee-jin |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151016211015/http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2957573 |df= }}{{cite web |title=Kim Yo Jong |url=https://nkleadershipwatch.wordpress.com/kji-2/kim-yo-jong/ |publisher=North Korea Leadership Watch |accessdate=15 October 2014 |date=11 July 2012}} According to reports first published in Japanese newspapers, he went to school in Switzerland near [[Bern]]. First reports claimed he attended the private English-language International School in [[Gümligen]] under the name "Chol-pak" or "Pak-chol" from 1993 to 1998.{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/01/AR2009060103750.html |work=The Washington Post |author=Blaine Harden |title=Son Named Heir to North Korea's Kim Studied in Switzerland, Reportedly Loves NBA |date=3 June 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110204205420/http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/01/AR2009060103750.html |archivedate=4 February 2011 }}
{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/7810203/Rare-photos-of-Kim-Jong-ils-youngest-son-Kim-Jong-un-released.html |location=London, UK |work=The Daily Telegraph |author=Peter Foster |title=Rare photos of Kim Jong-il's youngest son, Kim Jong-un, released |date=8 June 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100611052037/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/7810203/Rare-photos-of-Kim-Jong-ils-youngest-son-Kim-Jong-un-released.html |archivedate=11 June 2010 }}
{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/features/3245311/School-days-struggles-of-the-dictators-son-Kim-Jong-un.html |location=London, UK |work=The Sun |first1=Allan |last1=Hall |title=Profile |date=25 November 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101202063836/http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/features/3245311/School-days-struggles-of-the-dictators-son-Kim-Jong-un.html |archivedate=2 December 2010 }} He was described as shy, a good student who got along well with his classmates and was a basketball fan.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/jun/02/kim-jong-il-names-son-successor |title=North Korean leader Kim Jong‑il 'names youngest son as successor' |agency=Associated Press |work=The Guardian |location=London, UK |issn=0261-3077 |date=2 June 2009 |archive-date=16 October 2015 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151016211014/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/jun/02/kim-jong-il-names-son-successor |df= }} He was [[Chaperone (social)|chaperoned]] by an older student, who was thought to be his bodyguard.{{cite news|url=https://www.welt.de/welt_print/article3985896/Kim-Jong-un-und-sein-Unterricht-bei-den-Schweizern.html |title=Kim Jong-un und sein Unterricht bei den Schweizern |work=Die Welt |issn=0173-8437 |location=Berlin |first=Elisalex |last=Henckel |date=24 June 2009 |language=German |archivedate=27 July 2015 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150727053343/http://www.welt.de/welt_print/article3985896/Kim-Jong-un-und-sein-Unterricht-bei-den-Schweizern.html |df= }} Later, it was reported that Kim Jong-un attended the Liebefeld Steinhölzli [[state school]] in [[Köniz]] near Bern under the name "Pak-un" or "Un-pak" from 1998 until 2000 as the son of an employee of the North Korean embassy in Bern. Authorities of Köniz confirmed that a student from North Korea, registered as the son of a member of the embassy, attended the school from August 1998 until the autumn of 2000, but were unable to give details about his identity. Pak-un first attended a special class for foreign-language children and later attended the regular classes of the 6th, 7th, 8th, and part of the final 9th year, leaving the school abruptly in the autumn of 2000. He was described as a well-integrated and ambitious student who liked to play basketball.{{cite web|url=http://www.nzz.ch/nachrichten/panorama/weitere_nordkoreanische_spuren_in_bern_1.2748091.html |title=Weitere nordkoreanische Spuren in Bern |work=Neue Zürcher Zeitung |date=16 June 2009 |language=German |accessdate=19 December 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120211122422/http://www.nzz.ch/nachrichten/panorama/weitere_nordkoreanische_spuren_in_bern_1.2748091.html |archivedate=11 February 2012 }} However, his grades and attendance rating are reported to have been poor.{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/lifestyle/education/latest-news/poor-school-marks-of-north-koreas-kim-jongun-exposed-3068333.html|work=Irish Independent|issn=0791-685X|title=Poor school marks of North Korea's Kim Jong-un exposed|date=2 April 2012|archive-url=https://webcitation.org/query?date=2015-12-26&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.independent.ie%2Flife%2Ffamily%2Flearning%2Fpoor-school-marks-of-north-koreas-kim-jongun-exposed-26838819.html|archive-date=26 December 2015|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/9180501/Kim-Jong-uns-poor-marks-exposed.html |location=London, UK |work=The Daily Telegraph |title=Kim Jong-un's poor marks exposed |date=2 April 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120506125857/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/9180501/Kim-Jong-uns-poor-marks-exposed.html |archivedate=6 May 2012 }} The ambassador of North Korea in Switzerland, [[Ri Su-yong|Ri Chol]], had a close relationship with him and acted as a mentor.{{cite web|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/international/2010/09/05/01003-20100905ARTFIG00221-kim-jong-un-une-education-suisse-entouree-de-mysteres.php |title=Kim Jong-un : une éducation suisse entourée de mystères |work=Le Figaro |language=French |accessdate=19 December 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111219104625/http://www.lefigaro.fr/international/2010/09/05/01003-20100905ARTFIG00221-kim-jong-un-une-education-suisse-entouree-de-mysteres.php |archivedate=19 December 2011 }} One of Pak-un's classmates told reporters that he had told him that he was the son of the leader of North Korea.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/asiapcf/09/28/north.korea.heir.friend/ |publisher=CNN |title=North Korea: Nuclear Tension |date=29 September 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150609120331/http://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/asiapcf/09/28/north.korea.heir.friend |archivedate= 9 June 2015 |dead-url=no |first=Atika |last=Shubert |df= }}{{cite web|title=Mein Freund, der zukünftige Diktator Nordkoreas |author=Bernhard Odenahl |date=29 September 2009 |work=Tages-Anzeiger |language=German |url=http://www.tagesanzeiger.ch/ausland/asien-und-ozeanien/Mein-Freund-der-zukuenftige-Diktator-Nordkoreas-/story/20634972 |accessdate=29 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101002204137/http://www.tagesanzeiger.ch/ausland/asien-und-ozeanien/Mein-Freund-der-zukuenftige-Diktator-Nordkoreas-/story/20634972 |archivedate=2 October 2010 }} According to some reports, Kim was described by classmates as a shy child who was awkward with girls and indifferent to political issues, but who distinguished himself in sports and had a fascination with the American [[National Basketball Association]] and [[Michael Jordan]]. One friend claimed that he had been shown pictures of Pak-un with [[Kobe Bryant]] and [[Toni Kukoč]].{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2009/07/17/2009071700693.html |title=Classmates Recall Kim Jong-un's Basketball Obsession |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=17 July 2009 |accessdate=14 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170218082737/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2009/07/17/2009071700693.html |archivedate=18 February 2017 }} In April 2012, new documents came to light indicating that Kim Jong-un had lived in Switzerland since 1991 or 1992, earlier than previously thought.{{cite news|url=http://www.lematin.ch/suisse/kim-jongun-reste-neuf-ans-suisse/story/20273993 |title=Kim Jong-un est resté neuf ans en Suisse |author=Titus Plattner |accessdate=24 April 2012 |date=21 April 2012 |work=Le Matin |language=French |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130823194510/http://www.lematin.ch/suisse/kim-jongun-reste-neuf-ans-suisse/story/20273993 |archivedate=23 August 2013 }} The Laboratory of Anatomic Anthropology at the [[University of Lyon]], France, after comparing the picture of the boy Pak-un taken at the Liebefeld Steinhölzli school in 1999 with a picture of Kim Jong-un from 2012 came to the conclusion that the two faces show a conformity of 95%. The head of the institute, Raoul Perrot, a forensic anthropologist, considers it most likely that the two pictures show the same person.{{cite web|author1=Titus Plattner |author2=Daniel Glaus |author3=Julian Schmidli |url=http://www.sonntagszeitung.ch/fokus/artikel-detailseite/?newsid=212533 |title=Der Diktator aus Liebefeld |work=[[SonntagsZeitung]] |date=1 April 2012 |page=17 |language=German |accessdate=2 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66cIlKe2M?url=http://www.sonntagszeitung.ch/fokus/artikel-detailseite/?newsid=212533 |archivedate= 2 April 2012 |df= }}
"Der Schüler Un Pak ist identisch mit Kim Jong-un." It is believed that the student at the Gümligen International School may not have been Kim Jong-un, but his elder brother Kim Jong-chul. It is not known whether the student known as Pak-un in Liebefeld Steinhölzli lived in Switzerland prior to 1998.{{cite journal|title=Der Diktator spricht Deutsch |first1=Titus |last1=Plattner |first2=Julie |last2=Zaugg |date=8 May 2009 |work=Cicero |url=http://www.cicero.de/weltbühne/der-diktator-spricht-deutsch/39681 |language=de |archive-date=30 September 2015 |issn=1613-4826 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150930081816/http://www.cicero.de/weltb%C3%BChne/der-diktator-spricht-deutsch/39681 |df= }} All the children of Kim Jong-il are said to have lived in Switzerland, as well as the mother of the two youngest sons, who lived in [[Geneva]] for some time. Most analysts agree that Kim Jong-un attended [[Kim Il-sung University]], a leading officer-training school in Pyongyang, from 2002 to 2007.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/15/world/asia/15kim.html |title=North Korea's Heir Apparent Remains a Mystery |author=Choe Sang-Hun and Martin Fackler |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=14 June 2009 |accessdate=2 April 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6MEoQ4wBe?url=http://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/15/world/asia/15kim.html |archivedate=29 December 2013 }} In late February 2018, Reuters reported that Kim and his father had used forged passports—supposedly issued by [[Brazil]] and dated 26 February 1996—to apply for visas in various countries. Both 10-year passports carry a stamp saying "Embassy of Brazil in Prague". Kim Jong-un's passport records the name "Josef Pwag" and a date of birth of 1 February 1983.[http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-28/north-korea-kim-jong-un-father-used-fake-brazilian-passports/9494034 Kim Jong-un and father used fake Brazilian passports to apply for Western visas], [[Reuters]] per [[ABC News Online]]. 28 February 2018. Accessed on 12 April 2018. For many years, only one confirmed photograph of him was known to exist outside North Korea, apparently taken in the mid-1990s, when he was eleven.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11389824 |title=Tales of starvation and death in North Korea |publisher=BBC |date=22 September 2010 |accessdate=28 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100930044845/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11389824 |archivedate=30 September 2010 }} Occasionally other supposed images of him surfaced but were often disputed.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/asia-pacific/8078562.stm Profile: Kim Jong-un] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090605160315/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/asia-pacific/8078562.stm |date=5 June 2009 }}, BBC News, 2 June 2009
{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/04/25/world/asia/25succession.html |work=The New York Times |title=North Korea Appears to Tap Leader's Son as Enigmatic Heir |author=Martin Fackler |date=24 April 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170701003019/http://www.nytimes.com/2010/04/25/world/asia/25succession.html |archivedate=1 July 2017 }}
{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2010/04/21/2010042100633.html |title=Confusion Over Photo of N. Korean Leader‑to‑Be |work=The Chosun Ilbo |accessdate=28 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100701171022/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2010/04/21/2010042100633.html |archivedate=1 July 2010 }} It was only in June 2010, shortly before he was given official posts and publicly introduced to the North Korean people, that more pictures were released of Kim, taken when he was attending school in Switzerland.{{Cite news|title=The son also rises |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joinsmsn.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2921577 |newspaper=JoongAng Daily |date=9 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120108060815/http://koreajoongangdaily.joinsmsn.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2921577 |archivedate=8 January 2012 }}
{{Cite news|author=Peter Foster |title=Rare photos of Kim Jong-il's youngest son, Kim Jong-un, released |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/7810203/Rare-photos-of-Kim-Jong-ils-youngest-son-Kim-Jong-un-released.html |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=8 June 2010 |location=London, UK |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100611052037/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/7810203/Rare-photos-of-Kim-Jong-ils-youngest-son-Kim-Jong-un-released.html |archivedate=11 June 2010 }} The first official image of him as an adult was a group photograph released on 30 September 2010, at the end of the party conference that effectively anointed him, in which he is seated in the front row, two places from his father. This was followed by newsreel footage of him attending the conference.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11441504 New images of North Korea's heir apparent Kim Jong-un] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101001030218/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11441504 |date=1 October 2010 }}, BBC News, 30 September 2010. == Succession == === Pre-2010 Party Conference speculation === Kim Jong-un's eldest half-brother, [[Kim Jong-nam]], had been the favorite to succeed, but reportedly fell out of favor after 2001, when he was caught attempting to enter Japan on a [[fake passport]] to visit [[Tokyo Disneyland]].{{cite news|title=Kim Jong Il's Teen Grandson Spotted at Concert of S. Korean Pop Star|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2009/07/18/kim-jong-il-teen-grandson-spotted-at-concert-s-korean-pop-star.html|accessdate=20 May 2017|agency=Associated Press|publisher=Fox News|date=18 July 2009}} Kim Jong-nam [[Assassination of Kim Jong-nam|was killed]] in Malaysia in 2017 by suspected North Korean agents.{{cite news|title= Kim Jong-un's half-brother 'assassinated with poisoned needles at airport' |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/kim-jong-un-half-brother-killed-kim-jong-nam-malaysia-north-korea-leader-a7579246.html|work=The Independent|date=14 February 2017}} Kim Jong-il's former personal chef, [[Kenji Fujimoto]], revealed details regarding Kim Jong-un, with whom he had a good relationship,Lynn, Hyung Gu. (2007). ''Bipolar orders: the two Koreas since 1989.'' Zed Books. p. 122. {{ISBN|978-1-84277-743-5}}. stating that he was favored to be his father's successor. Fujimoto also said that Jong-un was favored by his father over his elder brother, Kim Jong-chul, reasoning that Jong-chul is too feminine in character, while Jong-un is "exactly like his father".Sang-hun, Choe; Fackler, Martin. [https://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/15/world/asia/15kim.html North Korea's Heir Apparent Remains a Mystery] {{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/6MEoQ4wBe?url=http://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/15/world/asia/15kim.html |date=29 December 2013 }}. ''[[The New York Times]]''. 14 June 2009 Furthermore, Fujimoto stated that "if power is to be handed over then Jong-un is the best for it. He has superb physical gifts, is a big drinker and never admits defeat." Also, according to Fujimoto, Jong-un smokes [[Yves Saint Laurent (brand)|Yves Saint Laurent]] cigarettes, loves [[Johnnie Walker]] whisky and has a [[Mercedes-Benz 600]] luxury sedan.[http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2010/12/20/2010122001136.html ''The Chosun Ilbo'' "Kim Jong-un 'Loves Nukes, Computer Games and Johnny Walker"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417065308/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2010/12/20/2010122001136.html |date=17 April 2016 }} (20 December 2010). Retrieved 23 April 2013. When Jong-un was 18, Fujimoto described an episode where Jong-un once questioned his lavish lifestyle and asked, "we are here, playing basketball, riding horses, riding jet skis, having fun together. But what of the lives of the average people?" On 15 January 2009, the South Korean news agency [[Yonhap]] reported that Kim Jong-il had appointed Kim Jong-un to be his successor.[http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/northkorea/2009/01/22/62/0401000000AEN20090121007400325F.HTML North Korea Newsletter No. 38] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722135931/http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/northkorea/2009/01/22/62/0401000000AEN20090121007400325F.HTML |date=22 July 2011 }}. Yonhap. 22 January 2009. On 8 March 2009, [[BBC News]] reported that Kim Jong-un was on the ballot for elections to the [[Supreme People's Assembly]], the [[rubber stamp (politics)|rubber stamp parliament]] of North Korea.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/7930775.stm "N Korea holds parliamentary poll"]. [[BBC News]]. Retrieved 8 March 2009. Subsequent reports indicated that his name did not appear on the list of lawmakers,{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601086&sid=aFAm9ndQmJpI&refer=latin_america |title=Kim Jong Il's Son, Possible Successor, Isn't Named as Lawmaker |publisher=Bloomberg |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629121818/http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aFAm9ndQmJpI&refer=latin_america |archive-date=29 June 2011 |dead-url=yes |author=Heejin Koo |date=9 March 2009 |df= }} but he was later elevated to a mid-level position in the [[National Defense Commission]], which is a branch of the North Korean military.{{cite web|first=James |last=Rosen |date=1 May 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090504024115/http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2009/05/01/north-korea-kim-begins-shifting-power-military/ |archive-date= 4 May 2009 |title=In North Korea, Ailing Kim Begins Shifting Power to Military |publisher=Fox News Channel |url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2009/05/01/north-korea-ailing-kim-begins-shifting-power-military.html |deadurl=yes |df= }} [[File:The statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang (april 2012).jpg|thumb|260px|People paying homage[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/dec/17/north-korea-homage-kim-dynasty ''North Korea pays homage to the Kim dynasty, past, present (and future?).''] Justin McCurry. The Guardian. London. 17 December 2012. Accessed 18 August 2017. to the statues of [[Kim Il-sung]] and Kim Jong-il, April 2012]] From 2009, it was understood by foreign diplomatic services that Kim was to succeed his father Kim Jong-il as the head of the Korean Workers' Party and ''de facto'' leader of North Korea.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/8078324.stm |title=N Korea names Kim's successor named |publisher=BBC |date=2 June 2009 |accessdate=14 June 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090608074810/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/8078324.stm |archivedate=8 June 2009 }} He has been named "Yŏngmyŏng-han Tongji" (영명한 동지), which loosely translates to "Brilliant Comrade".{{cite web|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2009/06/13/north-korean-leader039s-son-039brilliant-comrade039.html|title=North Korean leader's son is 'Brilliant Comrade|work=[[The Jakarta Post]]|date=13 June 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303175033/http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2009/06/13/north-korean-leader039s-son-039brilliant-comrade039.html|archivedate=3 March 2016}} His father had also asked embassy staff abroad to pledge loyalty to his son. There have also been reports that citizens in North Korea were encouraged to sing a newly composed "song of praise" to Kim Jong-un, in a similar fashion to that of [[Song of General Kim Jong-il|praise songs relating to Kim Jong-il]] and [[Song of General Kim Il-sung|Kim Il-sung]].{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/am/content/2009/s2632675.htm |title=North Koreans sing praises of dynastic dictatorship |work=AM |date=22 July 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090725031711/http://www.abc.net.au/am/content/2009/s2632675.htm |archivedate=25 July 2009 |dead-url=no |first=Mark |last=Willacy |publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |location=Sydney |df= }} Later, in June, Kim was reported to have visited [[China]] secretly to "present himself" to the Chinese leadership, who later warned against North Korea conducting another nuclear test.[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article6508436.ece Kim Jong Il's son 'made secret visit to China']. ''[[The Times]]''. 16 June 2009. The Chinese foreign ministry has strongly denied that this visit occurred.[http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2009/06/19/2009061900402.html China Dismisses Reports of Kim Jong-un Visit]. ''[[The Chosun Ilbo]]''. 19 June 2009
Harden, Blaine. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/01/AR2009060103750.html North Korea's Kim Jong Il Chooses Youngest Son as Heir] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110204205420/http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/01/AR2009060103750.html |date=4 February 2011 }}, ''[[The Washington Post]]'', 3 June 2009. In September 2009, it was reported that Kim Jong-il had secured support for the succession plan, after a propaganda campaign.{{cite news|first=Chang-Won |last=Lim |date=6 September 2009 |url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gvACCP7QGFdDDvwHxcbIph2Yw4pw |title={{not a typo|N|Korea}} backs Kim's succession plan: analysts |agency=Agence France-Presse |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219202429/http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gvACCP7QGFdDDvwHxcbIph2Yw4pw |archivedate=19 February 2014 |dead-url=yes |df= }} It is believed by some that Kim Jong-un was involved in the [[ROKS Cheonan sinking|''Cheonan'' sinking]]{{cite web|title=North Korean Propagandists Say Kim Jong‑il's Son Planned South Korea Attacks |work=International Business Times |date=24 December 2011 |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/north-korean-propagandists-say-kim-jong-ils-son-planned-south-korea-attacks-387228 |archivedate=26 December 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151226192629/http://www.ibtimes.com/north-korean-propagandists-say-kim-jong-ils-son-planned-south-korea-attacks-387228 |dead-url=no |first=Amrutha |last=Gayathri |df= }} and the [[bombardment of Yeonpyeong]]{{cite web|title=Kim Jong-un 'Masterminded Attacks on S. Korea' |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=3 August 2011 |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2011/08/03/2011080300499.html |accessdate=13 January 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110912031953/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2011/08/03/2011080300499.html |archivedate=12 September 2011 }} to strengthen his military credentials and facilitate a successful transition of power from his father.{{cite web|title=Korean Peninsula: After Cheonan Warship Sinking and Yeonpyeong Incidents|last=Chun|first=Kwang Ho|year=2011|publisher=Jeju Peace Institute|url=http://jpi.or.kr/skyboard/download.sky?code=jpiworld&fid=3286&gid=5322|archive-date=26 December 2015|format=PDF|archive-url=https://webcitation.org/query?date=2015-12-26&url=http%3A%2F%2Fjpi.or.kr%2Fskyboard%2Fdownload.sky%3Fcode%3Djpiworld%26fid%3D3286%26gid%3D5322|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} === Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission === Kim Jong-un was made a ''[[daejang]]'', the equivalent of a four-star [[General (United States)|general]] in the [[United States]],{{cite news|title=Is North Korea following the Chinese model? |publisher=BBC News |date=29 September 2010 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11432894 |accessdate=30 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100930040548/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11432894 |archivedate=30 September 2010 }} on 27 September 2010, a day ahead of a rare [[Workers' Party of Korea]] conference in Pyongyang, the first time North Korean media had mentioned him by name and despite him having no previous military experience.{{cite news|title=North Korea sets date for rare leadershipconference |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11378145 |accessdate=27 September 2010 |publisher=BBC News |date=21 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100924075815/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11378145 |archivedate=24 September 2010 }}
{{cite news|title=North Korean leader Kim Jong-il's son 'made a general' |publisher=BBC News |date=28 September 2010 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11417016 |accessdate=28 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100928045127/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11417016 |archivedate=28 September 2010 }}
{{cite news|title=North Korea's Kim paves way for family succession |publisher=BBC News |date=28 September 2010 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11426284 |accessdate=28 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100929045116/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11426284 |archivedate=29 September 2010 }} Despite the promotion, no further details, including verifiable portraits of Kim, were released.{{cite web|author=Matt Negrin |url=http://www.politico.com/politico44/perm/0910/little_kim_rises_47f34787-5587-48fd-b2a4-c11fa6a56599.html |title=N. Korean leader promotes his son |publisher=Politico.com |date=28 September 2010 |accessdate=28 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120113062741/http://www.politico.com/politico44/perm/0910/little_kim_rises_47f34787-5587-48fd-b2a4-c11fa6a56599.html |archivedate=13 January 2012 }} On 28 September 2010, he was named vice chairman of the [[Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea|Central Military Commission]] and appointed to the [[Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea|Central Committee of the Workers' Party]], in an apparent nod to become the successor to Kim Jong-il.{{Cite journal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11431415 |publisher=BBC News |title=North Korea leader's son given key party posts |date=28 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100929043702/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11431415 |archivedate=29 September 2010 }} On 10 October 2010, alongside his father, Kim Jong-un attended the ruling Workers' Party's 65th anniversary celebration. This was seen as confirming his position as the next leader of the Workers' Party. Unprecedented international press access was granted to the event, further indicating the importance of Kim Jong-un's presence.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/10/world/asia/10korea.html|work=The New York Times|title=Kim Jong-il's Heir Attends Parade|date=9 October 2010|author=Mark McDonald}} In January 2011, the regime reportedly began purging around 200 protégés of both Jong-un's uncle-in-law [[Jang Song-thaek]] and [[O Kuk-ryol]], the vice chairman of the [[National Defence Commission]], by either detention or execution to further prevent either man from rivaling Jong-un.{{cite news|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2011/01/10/2011011000554.html |title=N.Korea 'Purging Proteges of the Old Guard' |work=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |date=10 January 2011 |accessdate=19 December 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120110031142/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2011/01/10/2011011000554.html |archivedate=10 January 2012 }} == Leader of North Korea == [[File:Festival Arirang 0001 06.JPG|thumb|Portraits of Kim Jong-un's father and grandfather ([[Arirang Festival]] mass games in Pyongyang)]] On 17 December 2011, Kim Jong-il died. Despite the elder Kim's plans, it was not immediately clear after his death whether Jong-un would in fact take full power, and what his exact role in a new government would be.{{cite news|title=Kim Jong-il, North Korean leader, dies |first=Tania |last=Branigan |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/dec/19/kim-jong-il-north-korean-leader-dies |work=The Guardian |date=19 December 2011 |archive-date=14 August 2015 |location=London, UK |issn=0261-3077 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150814114449/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/dec/19/kim-jong-il-north-korean-leader-dies |dead-url=no |df= }} Some analysts had predicted that when Kim Jong-il died, [[Jang Song-thaek]] would act as [[regent]], as Jong-un was too inexperienced to immediately lead the country.{{cite news|title=Kim Jong‑il's heir Kim Jong‑un made general |first1=Rick |last1=Wallace |first2=Michael |last2=Sainsbury |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/kim-jong-ils-heir-kim-jong-un-made-general/story-e6frg6so-1225931178505 |newspaper=The Australian |issn=1038-8761 |date=29 September 2010 |archive-date=25 December 2013 |dead-url=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131225061032/http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/kim-jong-ils-heir-kim-jong-un-made-general/story-e6frg6so-1225931178505 |df= }}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-korea-north-power-idUSTRE7BO02I20111225 |title=North Korean power‑behind‑throne emerges as neighbors meet |agency=Reuters |date=25 December 2011 |archive-date= 7 January 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160107225817/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-korea-north-power-idUSTRE7BO02I20111225 |dead-url=no |first1=Sung-won |last1=Shim |first2=Kiyoshi |last2=Takenaka |first3=Chris |last3=Buckley |editor-first=Yoko |editor-last=Nishikawa |df= }} Following his father's death, Kim Jong-un was hailed as the "great successor to the revolutionary cause of [[Juche]]", "outstanding leader of the party, army and people"{{cite web|url=http://www.kcna.co.jp/item/2011/201112/news19/20111219-04ee.html |title=Notice to All Party Members, Servicepersons and People |publisher=Korean Central News Agency |date=19 December 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150311064222/http://www.kcna.co.jp/item/2011/201112/news19/20111219-04ee.html |archive-date=11 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |df= }} and "respected comrade who is identical to Supreme Commander Kim Jong-il",{{cite web|url=http://www.kcna.co.jp/item/2011/201112/news19/20111219-12ee.html |title=We Are under Respected Kim Jong Un |publisher=Korean Central News Agency |date=19 December 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141012023229/http://www.kcna.co.jp/item/2011/201112/news19/20111219-12ee.html |archivedate=12 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |df= }} and was made chairman of the Kim Jong-il funeral committee. The [[Korean Central News Agency]] described Kim Jong-un as "a great person born of heaven", a propaganda term only his father and grandfather had enjoyed.Associated Press (19 December 2011). [https://web.archive.org/web/20120113085114/http://www.chron.com/news/article/NKorea-grieves-Kim-Jong-Il-state-media-hails-son-2411026.php NKorea grieves Kim Jong Il, state media hails son], ''Houston Chronicle''. Retrieved 1 January 2012. And the ruling Workers' Party said in an editorial, "We vow with bleeding tears to call Kim Jong-un our supreme commander, our leader."{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2011-12-24/north-korea-s-media-begins-referring-to-kim-jong-un-as-supreme-commander- |title=N. Korea Media Begins Calling Kim Jong Un Supreme Commander |publisher=Bloomberg |date=24 December 2011 |last=Lee |first=Jiyeun |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160410123745/http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2011-12-24/north-korea-s-media-begins-referring-to-kim-jong-un-as-supreme-commander- |archivedate=10 April 2016 }} He was publicly declared [[Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army]] on 24 December 2011{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16325390 |title=North Korea: Kim Jong-un hailed 'supreme commander' |date=24 December 2011 |accessdate=24 December 2011 |publisher=BBC News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140107065350/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16325390 |archivedate=7 January 2014 }} and formally appointed to the position on 30 December 2011 when the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party "courteously proclaimed that the dear respected Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, assumed the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army". [[File:Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery 32.JPG|thumb|North Korean soldiers saluting at the [[Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery]] in Pyongyang, 2012]] On 26 December 2011, the leading North Korean newspaper ''[[Rodong Sinmun]]'' reported that Kim Jong-un had been acting as chairman of the Central Military Commission,[http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/topics/2011/12/26/81/4603000000AEN20111226003700315F.HTML N. Korean newspaper refers to successor son as head of key party organ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120526021309/http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/topics/2011/12/26/81/4603000000AEN20111226003700315F.HTML |date=26 May 2012 }} Yonhap News Agency, 26 December 2011. and supreme leader of the country, following his father's demise.{{cite news|author=Scott McDonald |url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/world/story/2011-12-30/north-korea-leadership/52280412/1 |title=North Korea vows no softening toward South |date=30 December 2011 |work=USA Today |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111230180135/http://www.usatoday.com/news/world/story/2011-12-30/north-korea-leadership/52280412/1 |archivedate=30 December 2011 }} On 9 January 2012, a large rally was held by the [[Korean People's Army]] in front of the [[Kumsusan Palace of the Sun]] to honor Kim Jong-un and to demonstrate loyalty.{{cite web|title=Military Rallies in Keumsusan Square |author=So Yeol Kim |accessdate=10 January 2012 |url=http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01700&num=8664 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120112211957/http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01700&num=8664 |archivedate=12 January 2012 }} In 2013, ''[[Forbes]]'' named Kim Jong-un [[Forbes list of The World's Most Powerful People|the World's 46th Most Powerful Person]].{{cite web |first=Caroline |last=Howard |title=The World's Most Powerful People 2013: No. 46: Kim Jong Un |url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/lmh45kjle/no-46-kim-jong-un/ |work=Forbes |archive-url=https://webcitation.org/query?date=2015-12-26&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.forbes.com%2Fpictures%2Flmh45kjle%2Fno-46-kim-jong-un%2F |dead-url=no |archive-date=26 December 2015 |date=30 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} === Assuming official titles === On 27 March 2012, Kim was elected to the Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea. On 11 April, that conference wrote the post of general secretary out of the party charter and instead designated Kim Jong-il as the party's "Eternal General Secretary". The conference then elected Kim Jong-un as leader of the party under the newly created title of First Secretary. Kim Jong-un also took his father's post as Chairman of the Central Military Commission, as well as his father's old seat on the [[Presidium of the Politburo of the Workers' Party of Korea|Politburo Presidium]].{{cite web|title=Kim Takes More Top Posts |author=Chris Green |accessdate=12 April 2012 |url=http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01700&num=9100 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120415020037/http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01700&num=9100 |archivedate=15 April 2012 }} In a speech made prior to the Conference, Kim Jong-un declared that "Imbuing the whole society with Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is the highest programme of our Party".{{cite book|author=Kim Jong-un|title=Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party: Talk to Senior Officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea|url=http://www.korean-books.com.kp/en/packages/xnps/download.pg.php?122#.pdf|accessdate=9 May 2018|date=6 April 2012|publisher=Foreign Languages Publishing House|location=[Pyongyang]|oclc=988748608|page=6}} On 13 April 2012, the 5th Session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly appointed Kim Jong-un [[Chairman of the National Defence Commission]].{{Cite web | title = Part II: The Kim Family Reigns: Preserving the Monarchy and Strengthening the Party-State | last = Mansourov | first = Alexandre | work = 38 North | date = 19 December 2012 | accessdate = 9 May 2018 | url = https://www.38north.org/2012/12/amansourov121912/ }} On 15 April 2012, during a military parade to commemorate Kim Il-sung's centenary, Kim Jong-un made his first public speech, ''[[Let Us March Forward Dynamically Towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun]]''.{{cite news|publisher=BBC |accessdate=14 April 2012 |date=14 April 2012 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-17718011 |title=N Korea's Kim Jong-un speaks publicly for first time |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120415181357/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-17718011 |archivedate=15 April 2012 }} That speech became the basis of a hymn dedicated to him, "[[Onwards Toward the Final Victory]]".{{cite news|first=Tania |last=Branigan |title=North Korea's Kim Jong-un gets new official theme song |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/06/north-korea-kim-jong-un-song |archive-date= 2 August 2015 |work=The Guardian |date=6 July 2012 |issn=0261-3077 |location=London, UK |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150802102716/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/06/north-korea-kim-jong-un-song |dead-url=no |df= }} In July 2012, Kim Jong-un was promoted to [[Wonsu (North Korea)|wonsu]] (translated as [[marshal]]), the highest active rank in the military. The decision was jointly issued on by the Central Committee and the [[Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea|Central Military Commission]] of the Workers' Party of Korea, the National Defence Commission, and the [[Presidium]] of the [[Supreme People's Assembly]], the [[Korean Central News Agency]] subsequently announced. The only higher rank is [[Dae Wonsu]] (roughly translated as [[Grand Marshal]] or [[Generalissimo]]) which was held by Kim's grandfather, Kim Il-sung, and which was awarded posthumously to his father, Kim Jong-il, in February 2012.{{cite news|last=Green |first=Chris |title=Kim Jong Eun Promoted to Marshal |url=http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01700&num=9533 |accessdate=18 July 2012 |work=Daily NK |date=18 July 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004213840/http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01700&num=9533 |archivedate=4 October 2013 }} The promotion confirmed Kim's role as top leader of the North Korean military and came days after the replacement of Chief of General Staff [[Ri Yong-ho (general)|Ri Yong-ho]] by [[Hyon Yong-chol]]. {{external image|image1=[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-20461822 Satellite imagery show the message "Long Live General Kim Jong-un, the Shining Sun!" in Korean on a hillside.]}} In November 2012, satellite photos revealed a half-kilometer-long ({{convert|0.5|km|ft|disp=out}}) propaganda message carved into a hillside in [[Ryanggang Province]], reading, "Long Live General Kim Jong-un, the Shining Sun!"{{cite news |title=Half-kilometre long Kim Jong-un propaganda message visible from space |work=National Post |issn=1486-8008 |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/news/half-kilometre-long-kim-jong-un-propaganda-message-visible-from-space |date=23 November 2012 |df= |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://wayback.archive-it.org/all/20170419204737/http://news.nationalpost.com/news/half-kilometre-long-kim-jong-un-propaganda-message-visible-from-space |archivedate=19 April 2017 }} Kim Jong-il's personal chef [[Kenji Fujimoto]] stated, "Stores in Pyongyang were brimming with products and people in the streets looked cheerful. North Korea has changed a lot since Kim Jong-un assumed power. All of this is because of leader Kim Jong-un."{{cite web|first=Justin |last=McCurry |date=10 August 2012 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/aug/10/kim-jong-il-japan-chef |title=Kim Jong‑il's personal Japanese chef returns to land he fled |work=The Guardian |archivedate= 2 July 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702173449/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/aug/10/kim-jong-il-japan-chef |dead-url=no |location=London, UK |issn=0261-3077 |df= }} [[File:Kim Jong Il Books (33012753981).jpg|thumb|upright|A selection of [[Kim Jong-un's works]]]] Officially, Kim Jong-un is part of a [[triumvirate]] heading the executive branch of the North Korean government along with Premier [[Pak Pong-ju]] and parliament chairman [[Kim Yong-nam]] (no relation). Each nominally holds powers equivalent to a third of a president's powers in most presidential systems. Kim Jong-un commands the armed forces, Pak Pong-ju heads the government, and Kim Yong-nam handles foreign relations. Nevertheless, it is generally understood that Kim Jong-un, like his father and grandfather before him, exercises absolute control over the government and the country. Indeed, a constitutional amendment enacted by his father explicitly named the NDC (first) chairman as "the supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of North Korea".{{cite web|title=DPRK has quietly amended its Constitution |last=Petrov |first=Leonid |work=Leonid Petrov's KOREA VISION |date=12 October 2009 |accessdate=12 September 2015 |url=https://leonidpetrov.wordpress.com/2009/10/12/dprk-has-quietly-amended-its-constitution/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151016015037/https://leonidpetrov.wordpress.com/2009/10/12/dprk-has-quietly-amended-its-constitution/ |archivedate=16 October 2015 }}
{{cite book|others=Amended and supplemented on 1 April, Juche 102 (2013), at the Seventh Session of the Twelfth Supreme People's Assembly |title=Socialist Constitution of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea |url=http://www.naenara.com.kp/en/book/download.php?4+4047 |year=2014 |format=PDF |publisher=Foreign Languages Publishing House |location=Pyongyang |isbn=978-9946-0-1099-1 |page=22 |chapter=Article 100 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160608030306/http://www.naenara.com.kp/en/book/download.php?4+4047 |archivedate=8 June 2016 }} On 30 November 2012, Kim met with [[Li Jianguo]], who "briefed Kim on the [[18th National Congress of the Communist Party of China|18th National Congress]] of the [[Communist Party of China]]", according to the state's official news agency, the [[Korean Central News Agency]].{{cite web|title=Kim Jong-un Gets Letter from China's New Leader |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2012/12/03/2012120301309.html |publisher=Chosun.com |accessdate=6 December 2012 |date=3 December 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121206041056/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2012/12/03/2012120301309.html |archivedate=6 December 2012 }} A letter from [[Xi Jinping]], [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of China]], was hand-delivered during the discussion. In 2013, Kim re-established his grandfather's style when he made his first New Year's address, a break from the approach of his father. Kim Jong-il never made televised addresses during his 17 years in power.[http://www.cnn.com/2013/01/01/world/asia/north-korea-kim-speech/index.html In first New Year speech, North Korea's Kim Jong Un calls for economic revamp] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131205121010/http://www.cnn.com/2013/01/01/world/asia/north-korea-kim-speech/index.html |date=5 December 2013 }}, CNN, 2 January 2013. Retrieved 23 April 2013. In lieu of delivering a speech, Kim Jong-il contributed to and approved a New Year's Day editorial, jointly published by ''Rodong Sinmun'' (the daily newspaper of the Korean Workers' Party), ''[[Joson Inmingun]]'' (the newspaper of the Korean People's Army), and ''[[Chongnyon Jonwi]]'' (the newspaper of the [[Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League]]).[http://nkleadershipwatch.wordpress.com/ "KJU Delivers New Year's Day Address"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100608051801/http://nkleadershipwatch.wordpress.com/ |date=8 June 2010 }}. Nkleadershipwatch.wordpress.com. Retrieved 23 April 2013. At the extraordinary meeting with his top defense and security officials on 26 January 2013, Kim issued orders on preparations for a new nuclear test and introduced [[martial law]] in North Korea effective from 29 January.{{cite web|title=North Korea 'under martial law' |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/9838626/North-Korea-under-martial-law.html |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=31 January 2013 |date=31 January 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130131145515/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/9838626/North-Korea-under-martial-law.html |archivedate=31 January 2013 }}
{{cite news|script-title=ru:В КНДР в преддверии ядерных испытаний введено военное положение |url=http://ria.ru/world/20130131/920676089.html |agency=[[RIA Novosti]] |language=Russian |accessdate=31 January 2013 |date=31 January 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130131171739/http://ria.ru/world/20130131/920676089.html |archivedate=31 January 2013 }} On 9 March 2014, Kim Jong-un was elected to a seat in the [[Supreme People's Assembly]], the country's [[Unicameralism|unicameral]] [[legislature]]. He ran unopposed, but voters had the choice of voting yes or no. There was a record turnout of voters and, according to government officials, all voted "yes" in his home district of [[Mount Paekdu]].{{cite news|title=North Korea's Kim Jong-un elected to assembly without single vote against |agency=Associated Press |work=The Guardian |date=10 March 2014 |accessdate=4 August 2016 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/mar/10/north-koreas-kim-jong-un-elected-assembly-vote-against |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160826080442/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/mar/10/north-koreas-kim-jong-un-elected-assembly-vote-against |archivedate=26 August 2016 }} The Supreme People's Assembly subsequently elected him first chairman of the [[National Defense Commission]].{{cite news|title=Leader Tightens Hold on Power in North Korea |last=Sang-Hun |first=Choe |work=The New York Times |date=9 April 2014 |accessdate=4 August 2016 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/10/world/asia/kim-further-consolidates-power-as-north-koreas-leader.html |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160920214043/http://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/10/world/asia/kim-further-consolidates-power-as-north-koreas-leader.html |archivedate=20 September 2016 }} [[File:0921 - Nordkorea 2015 - Pjöngjang - Public Viewing am Bahnhofsplatz (22584958809).jpg|thumb|230px|People in Pyongyang watch Kim Jong-un on [[Korean Central Television|North Korean TV]], 2015]] In May 2014, following the collapse of an apartment building in Pyongyang, Kim Jong-un was said to be very upset at the loss of life that resulted. A statement issued by the country's official news agency the [[Korean Central News Agency]] used the rare expression "profound consolation and apology". An unnamed government official was quoted by the [[BBC]] as saying Kim Jong-un had "sat up all night, feeling painful".{{cite web|title=North Korea offers rare apology after apartment building collapses |last=Chasmar |first=Jessica |work=The Washingtion Times |date=18 May 2014 |accessdate=2 January 2015 |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/may/18/north-korea-offers-rare-apology-after-apartment-bu/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150108201410/http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/may/18/north-korea-offers-rare-apology-after-apartment-bu/ |archivedate=8 January 2015 }} While the height of the building and the number of casualties was not released, media reports described it is a 23-story building and indicated that more than a hundred people may have died in the collapse.{{cite web|title=North Korea: Apology over Pyongyang building collapse |publisher=BBC News |date=18 May 2014 |accessdate=4 August 2016 |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-27459186 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160917041928/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-27459186 |archivedate=17 September 2016 }} === Economic policies === A set of comprehensive economic measures, the "Socialist Corporate Responsible Management System", were introduced in 2013.
