The measures increase the autonomy of enterprises by granting them "certain rights to engage in business activities autonomously and elevate the will to labor through appropriately implementing the socialist distribution system". Another priority of economic policies that year was agriculture, where the ''pojon'' (vegetable garden) responsibility system was implemented. The system reportedly achieved a major increase in output in some collective farms.{{cite web|url=http://ifes.kyungnam.ac.kr/eng/FRM/FRM_0101V.aspx?code=FRM150224_0001 |title="Socialist Enterprise Management System" under Full Implementation |publisher=Institute for Far Eastern Studies |date=24 February 2015 |accessdate=28 April 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702134340/http://ifes.kyungnam.ac.kr/eng/FRM/FRM_0101V.aspx?code=FRM150224_0001 |archivedate=2 July 2015 }} North Korean media were describing the economy as a "flexible collectivist system" where enterprises were applying "active and evolutionary actions" to achieve economic development. These reports reflect Kim's general economic policy of reforming management, increasing the autonomy and incentives for economic actors. This set of reforms known as the "May 30th measures" reaffirms both socialist ownership and "objective economic laws in guidance and management" to improve living standards. Other objectives of the measures are to increase the availability of domestically manufactured goods on markets, introduction of defence innovations into the civilian sector and boost international trade.{{cite web|url=http://ifes.kyungnam.ac.kr/eng/FRM/FRM_0101V.aspx?code=FRM150115_0001 |title=Kim Jong Un Stresses the Principles of Market Economy through 'May 30th Measures' |publisher=Institute for Far Eastern Studies |date=15 January 2015 |accessdate=28 April 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702103857/http://ifes.kyungnam.ac.kr/eng/FRM/FRM_0101V.aspx?code=FRM150115_0001 |archivedate=2 July 2015 }} === Purges and executions === {{See|List of officials purged and executed by Kim Jong-un}} As with all reporting on North Korea, reports of purges and executions are difficult to verify.{{cite news|last1=Trianni |first1=Francesca |title=Did Kim Jong Un Really Execute His Uncle's Extended Family? |url=http://time.com/2087/did-kim-jong-un-really-execute-his-uncles-extended-family/ |accessdate=28 May 2016 |work=Time |date=27 January 2014 |location=1:04–1:10 in embedded video |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160309222443/http://time.com/2087/did-kim-jong-un-really-execute-his-uncles-extended-family/ |archivedate=9 March 2016 }} In May 2016, analysts were surprised to find that General [[Ri Yong-gil]], reported by South Korea to have been executed earlier in the year, was, in fact, alive and well.{{cite news|title=Ri Yong-gil, North Korean general thought to be executed, is actually alive|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/10/ri-yong-gil-north-korean-general-thought-be-execut/?page=all|accessdate=28 May 2016|work=The Washingtion Times|date=10 May 2016}} In December 2013, Kim Jong-un's uncle [[Jang Song-thaek]] was arrested and executed for treachery.[https://www.economist.com/news/asia/21591581-kim-jong-un-has-managed-improbable-feat-making-north-korea-even-scarier-crying-uncle Crying uncle] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131212222959/http://www.economist.com/news/asia/21591581-kim-jong-un-has-managed-improbable-feat-making-north-korea-even-scarier-crying-uncle |date=12 December 2013 }} ''[[The Economist]]'', 14 December 2013. Jang is believed to have been executed by firing squad. [[Yonhap]] has stated that, according to multiple unnamed sources, Kim Jong-un has also put to death members of Jang's family, to completely destroy all traces of Jang's existence through "extensive executions" of his family, including the children and grandchildren of all close relatives. Those reportedly killed in Kim's purge include Jang's sister Jang Kye-sun, her husband and ambassador to Cuba, Jon Yong-jin, and Jang's nephew and ambassador to Malaysia, Jang Yong-chol. The nephew's two sons were also said to have been killed.{{cite web|url=http://www.wantchinatimes.com//news-subclass-cnt.aspx?id=20140127000056&cid=1101 |title=Jang Sung-taek's remaining family executed by Kim Jong-un |work=[[Want China Times]] |date=27 January 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150705171755/http://www.wantchinatimes.com/news-subclass-cnt.aspx/?id=20140127000056&cid=1101 |archivedate= 5 July 2015 |dead-url=yes |df= }}
{{cite news|title=N Korea executes relatives of Kim Jong-Un's dead uncle: reports |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-01-27/north-korea-executes-family-of-uncle-of-kim-jong-un-reports-say/5221194 |accessdate=28 May 2016 |publisher=ABC News |date=27 January 2014 |language=en-AU |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160518023244/http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-01-27/north-korea-executes-family-of-uncle-of-kim-jong-un-reports-say/5221194 |archivedate=18 May 2016 }} At the time of Jang's removal, it was announced that "the discovery and purge of the Jang group ... made our party and revolutionary ranks purer ..."[http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/830936.shtml Kim's uncle stripped of all posts, expelled from WPK] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131212112426/http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/830936.shtml |date=12 December 2013 }} ''[[Xinhua News Agency]]'' and after his execution on 12 December 2013 state media warned that the army "will never pardon all those who disobey the order of the Supreme Commander".[http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2013/12/13/12/0301000000AEN20131213002400315F.html N. Korea executes leader's uncle for 'treason': KCNA] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131222043735/http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/national/2013/12/13/12/0301000000AEN20131213002400315F.html |date=22 December 2013 }} ''[[Yonhap]]'' 13 December 2013. O Sang-hon ({{korean|오상헌|rr= O Sangheon|mr=O Sanghŏn|context=north}}) was a deputy security minister in the [[Ministry of People's Security]] in the government of North Korea who was reportedly killed in a political purge in 2014. According to the South Korean newspaper ''[[The Chosun Ilbo]]'', O was executed by [[flamethrower]] for his role in supporting Kim Jong-un's uncle Jang Song-taek.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/10750082/North-Korean-official-executed-by-flame-thrower.html |title=North Korean official 'executed by flame-thrower' |author=Julian Ryall |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=7 April 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160426010236/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/10750082/North-Korean-official-executed-by-flame-thrower.html |archivedate=26 April 2016 }}
{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/04/07/2014040700892.html |title=N.Korea Shuts Down Jang Song-taek's Department |work=Chosun Ilbo |date=7 April 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150507031034/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/04/07/2014040700892.html |archivedate=7 May 2015 }} === Human rights violations === {{See also|Human rights in North Korea}} Human rights violations under the leadership of Kim Jong-il were condemned by the [[UN General Assembly]].{{cite web|title=UN General Assembly slams Pyongyang's human rights record |work=China Post |date=21 December 2011 |url=http://www.chinapost.com.tw/asia/korea/2011/12/21/326591/UN-General.htm |accessdate=13 January 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130518113629/http://www.chinapost.com.tw/asia/korea/2011/12/21/326591/UN-General.htm |archivedate=18 May 2013 }} Press reports indicate that they are continuing under Kim Jong-un.{{cite news|title=North Korea's Kim Jong Un wages defector crackdown |work=Los Angeles Times |date=5 January 2012|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/world_now/2012/01/kim-jong-il-death-new-north-korean-leader-kim-jong-un-crackdown-on-defectors.html |accessdate=13 January 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120108221904/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/world_now/2012/01/kim-jong-il-death-new-north-korean-leader-kim-jong-un-crackdown-on-defectors.html|archivedate=8 January 2012}}
{{cite web|title=N. Korea's killing of 3 would-be defectors|work=The Dong-A Ilbo|date=4 January 2012|url=http://english.donga.com/srv/service.php3?biid=2012010422968|accessdate=13 January 2012|deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121116000552/http://english.donga.com/srv/service.php3?biid=2012010422968 |archivedate=16 November 2012 }}
{{cite web|title=Boomerangs Usually Come Back |work=Daily NK |date=11 January 2011 |url=http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk03600&num=8669 |accessdate=13 January 2012 |deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120113023132/http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk03600&num=8669 |archivedate=13 January 2012 }}
{{cite web|title=Harsh Punishments for Poor Mourning |work=Daily NK |date=11 January 2011 |url=http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01500&num=8668 |accessdate=13 January 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130824050537/http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk01500&num=8668 |archivedate=24 August 2013 }} The 2013 report on the situation of human rights in North Korea{{cite web|title=Report of the Special Rapporteur on the situation of human rights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Marzuki Darusman |work=United Nations Human Rights Council |date=1 February 2013 |url=http://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/Report%20of%20the%20Special%20Rapporteur%20on%20the%20situation%20of%20human%20rights%20in%20the%20Democratic%20People%E2%80%99s%20Republic%20of%20Korea%20A-HRC-22-57.pdf |accessdate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004215248/http://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/Report%20of%20the%20Special%20Rapporteur%20on%20the%20situation%20of%20human%20rights%20in%20the%20Democratic%20People%E2%80%99s%20Republic%20of%20Korea%20A-HRC-22-57.pdf |archivedate=4 October 2013 }} by [[United Nations Special Rapporteur]] [[Marzuki Darusman]] proposed a United Nations commission of inquiry{{cite web|title=North Korea human rights probe urged by UN |work=The Christian Science Monitor |date=5 February 2013 |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Latest-News-Wires/2013/0205/North-Korea-human-rights-probe-urged-by-UN |accessdate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130225074501/http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Latest-News-Wires/2013/0205/North-Korea-human-rights-probe-urged-by-UN |archivedate=25 February 2013 }} to document the accountability of Kim Jong-un and other individuals in the North Korean government for alleged [[crimes against humanity]].{{cite news|title=U.N.'s Pillay says may be crimes against humanity in North Korea |agency=Reuters |date=14 January 2013 |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/01/14/us-korea-north-rights-idUSBRE90D0DB20130114 |accessdate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130210235223/http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/01/14/us-korea-north-rights-idUSBRE90D0DB20130114 |archivedate=10 February 2013 }} The [[Report of the Commission of Inquiry on Human Rights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea|report of the commission of inquiry]]{{cite web|title=Report of the Commission of Inquiry on Human Rights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea |work=United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights |url=http://www.ohchr.org/EN/HRBodies/HRC/CoIDPRK/Pages/ReportoftheCommissionofInquiryDPRK.aspx |author1=Michael Kirby |author2=Marzuki Darusman |author3=Sonja Biserko |date=17 February 2014 |accessdate=18 February 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140217224637/http://www.ohchr.org/EN/HRBodies/HRC/CoIDPRK/Pages/ReportoftheCommissionofInquiryDPRK.aspx |archivedate=17 February 2014 }} was published in February 2014 and recommends making him accountable for crimes against humanity at the [[International Criminal Court]].{{cite news|title=U.N. Panel Says North Korean Leader Could Face Trial |work=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/02/18/world/asia/un-panel-says-north-korean-leader-could-face-trial.html |author=Nick Cumming-Bruce |date=17 February 2014 |accessdate=18 February 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140218065002/http://www.nytimes.com/2014/02/18/world/asia/un-panel-says-north-korean-leader-could-face-trial.html |archivedate=18 February 2014 }} In July 2016, the [[United States Department of the Treasury]] imposed personal sanctions on Kim. Although his involvement in human rights abuses was cited as the reason,{{cite news|title=Kim Jong-un placed on sanctions blacklist for the first time by US |agency=Agence France-Presse |work=The Guardian |date=6 July 2016 |accessdate=4 August 2016 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jul/06/north-korea-kim-jong-sanctions-blacklist |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160812121754/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jul/06/north-korea-kim-jong-sanctions-blacklist |archivedate=12 August 2016 }} officials said the sanctions target the country's nuclear and missile programs.{{cite web|last=Solomon |first=Jay |title=U.S. Puts First Sanctions on North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=6 July 2016 |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-sanctions-north-korean-leader-kim-jong-un-for-first-time-1467825770 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220123152/http://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-sanctions-north-korean-leader-kim-jong-un-for-first-time-1467825770 |archivedate=20 December 2016 }} In June 2017, President Trump condemned Kim Jong-un's "brutal" regime and described Kim as a "madman" after the death of American student [[Otto Warmbier]] who had been imprisoned during a visit to North Korea.{{cite news |title=North Korea calls Donald Trump a 'psychopath' following death of Otto Warmbier |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/north-korea-donald-trump-psychopath-otto-warmbier-missile-strike-kim-jong-un-a7804491.html |work=The Independent |date=23 June 2017}} ===Alleged 2017 CIA assassination attempt=== In May 2017, the North Korean government stated that the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] (CIA) of the United States and the South Korean [[National Intelligence Service (South Korea)|National Intelligence Service]] (NIS) hired a North Korean [[lumberjack]] who worked in [[Russia]] to assassinate Kim Jong-un with a "biochemical weapon" that was both [[radioactive]] and nano-poisonous, and whose effect would have been delayed by a few months.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/05/asia/north-korea-kim-assassination/index.html |title=North Korea claims US 'biochemical' plot to kill Kim Jong Un |first=James Griffiths |last=CNN |website=CNN |accessdate=20 May 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170519140041/http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/05/asia/north-korea-kim-assassination/index.html |archivedate=19 May 2017 }} North Korea said that it would seek extradition of anyone involved in the assassination attempt.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2017/05/11/north-korea-will-seek-extradition-anyone-involved-in-alleged-kim-assassination.html |title=North Korea will seek extradition of anyone involved in alleged Kim assassination |date=11 May 2017 |publisher= |accessdate=20 May 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170511111128/http://www.foxnews.com/world/2017/05/11/north-korea-will-seek-extradition-anyone-involved-in-alleged-kim-assassination.html |archivedate=11 May 2017 }} === Nuclear weapons development === {{See also|North Korea and weapons of mass destruction}} [[File:Unha-9 rocket model.jpg|thumb|left|Model of a [[Unha]]-9 rocket on display at a floral exhibition in Pyongyang, 30 August 2013]] Under Kim Jong-un, North Korea has continued to develop nuclear weapons. At a plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party held on 31 March 2013, Kim Jong-un announced that North Korea will adopt "a new strategic line on carrying out economic construction and building nuclear armed forces simultaneously".{{cite web|title=Report on Plenary Meeting of WPK Central Committee |url=http://www.kcna.co.jp/item/2013/201303/news31/20130331-24ee.html |publisher=[[Korean Central News Agency]] |archive-date= 3 April 2015 |date=31 March 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403171327/http://www.kcna.co.jp/item/2013/201303/news31/20130331-24ee.html |deadurl=yes |df= }} According to several analysts, North Korea sees the nuclear arsenal as vital to deter an attack, and it is unlikely that North Korea would launch a nuclear war.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/politics/north-korea-nuclear-bomb-war-south-atomic-ballistic-missile-test-a7578016.html |title=Should we really be so afraid of a nuclear North Korea? |first1=Markus |last1=Bell |first2=Marco |last2=Milani |work=The Independent |date=16 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170216012421/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/politics/north-korea-nuclear-bomb-war-south-atomic-ballistic-missile-test-a7578016.html |archivedate=16 February 2017 }}
{{cite news|url=http://fpif.org/north-koreas-nuclear-ticket-survival/ |title=North Korea's Nuclear Ticket to Survival |first=Edward |last=Hunt |publisher=Foreign Policy in Focus |date=31 October 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170325112931/http://fpif.org/north-koreas-nuclear-ticket-survival/ |archivedate=25 March 2017 }} According to a [[RAND Corporation]] senior researcher, Kim Jong-un believes that nuclear weapons are his guarantee of regime survival.{{cite web|url=https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/north-koreas-military-capabilities|title=What's the Status of North Korea's Nuclear Program?|author=|date=|website=[[Council on Foreign Relations]]|accessdate=8 October 2017}} During the 7th [[Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea]] in 2016, Kim Jong-un stated that North Korea would "not use nuclear weapons first unless aggressive hostile forces use nuclear weapons to invade on our sovereignty".{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/north-korea-party-give-kim-jong-title-38948654 |title=Kim Jong Un Says Pyongyang Won't Use Nukes First; Associated Press |publisher=ABC |date=7 May 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160508122147/http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/north-korea-party-give-kim-jong-title-38948654 |archivedate=8 May 2016 }} However, on other occasions, North Korea has threatened [[Preemptive war|"pre-emptive" nuclear attacks]] against a US-led attack.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/03/06/asia/north-korea-preemptive-nuclear-strike-threat/ |title=North Korea threatens nuclear strike over U.S.-South Korean |publisher=CNN |date=7 March 2016 |accessdate=22 May 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160524135322/http://www.cnn.com/2016/03/06/asia/north-korea-preemptive-nuclear-strike-threat/ |archivedate=24 May 2016 }}
{{cite news|url=http://worldnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/03/07/17220065-un-passes-sanctions-despite-north-korea-threat-of-pre-emptive-nuclear-attack |title=UN passes sanctions despite North Korea threat of 'pre-emptive nuclear attack' |publisher=NBC News |date=7 March 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130309191714/http://worldnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/03/07/17220065-un-passes-sanctions-despite-north-korea-threat-of-pre-emptive-nuclear-attack |archivedate=9 March 2013 }} In December 2015, Kim stated that his family "turned the DPRK into a powerful nuclear weapons state ready to detonate a self-reliant A-bomb and H-bomb to reliably defend its sovereignty and the dignity of the nation".{{cite web|title=Kim Jong-Un claims North Korea has a hydrogen bomb |url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2015/12/10/kim-jong-un-claims-north-korea-has-hydrogen-bomb/ |publisher=Fox News Channel |accessdate=11 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151213060907/http://www.foxnews.com/world/2015/12/10/kim-jong-un-claims-north-korea-has-hydrogen-bomb/ |archivedate=13 December 2015 }} In January 2018, estimates of North Korea's nuclear arsenal ranged between 15 and 60 bombs, probably including [[hydrogen bombs]]. In the opinion of analysts, the [[Hwasong-15]] missile is capable of striking anywhere in the United States.{{cite web|url=https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/north-koreas-military-capabilities|title=North Korea's Military Capabilities|first=Eleanor|last=Albert|publisher=Council on Foreign Relations|date=3 January 2018}} The United Nations enacted a series of [[sanctions against North Korea]] for its nuclear program and missile tests.{{cite web|title=UN Security Council Resolutions on North Korea |url=https://www.armscontrol.org/factsheets/UN-Security-Council-Resolutions-on-North-Korea |publisher=[[Arms Control Association]] |accessdate=21 September 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170415112133/https://www.armscontrol.org/factsheets/UN-Security-Council-Resolutions-on-North-Korea |archivedate=15 April 2017 }} ===Détente in 2018=== [[File:2018 inter-Korean summit 01.jpg|thumb|upright=1.2|Kim and South Korean President [[Moon Jae-in]] shake hands during the [[April 2018 inter-Korean summit|2018 inter-Korean Summit]], April 2018]] [[File:Kim and Trump shaking hands at the red carpet during the DPRK–USA Singapore Summit.jpg|thumb|upright=1.2|Kim and U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] shake hands at the start of the [[2018 North Korea–United States summit]], June 2018]] [[File:Secretary Pompeo and Chairman Kim Attend Working Lunch in Pyongyang (44430194844).jpg|thumb|upright=1.2|Kim and U.S. Secretary of State [[Mike Pompeo]] in Pyongyang, October 2018]] In his 2018 New Year Speech, Kim announced that he was open to dialogue with South Korea with a view to take part in the [[North Korea at the 2018 Winter Olympics|upcoming Winter Olympics]] in the South.{{cite web|title=Kim Jong Un says he's 'open to dialogue' with South Korea so North Korea can compete in the Olympics — and Seoul wants to talk|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/kim-jong-un-north-korea-south-korea-talks-2018-1|work=Business Insider|accessdate=12 April 2018}} The [[Seoul–Pyongyang hotline]] was reopened after almost two years.{{Cite web|title=North Korea reopens cross-border communication channel with South Korea|last=Kim |first=Hyung-Jin|work=Chicago Tribune|agency=AP|date=3 January 2018|accessdate=5 January 2018 |url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-south-korea-talks-north-20180102-story.html |deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180104221341/http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-south-korea-talks-north-20180102-story.html |archivedate=4 January 2018}} North and South Korea marched together in the Olympics opening ceremony, and fielded a [[Korea women's national ice hockey team|united women's ice hockey team]] that finished eighth.{{cite news |url=http://time.com/5142964/korea-hockey-olympics-winter-2018/|title='Cheer Up!' North Korean Cheerleaders Rally Unified Women's Hockey Team During 8-0 Loss|first1=Sean|last1=Gregory|location=Gangneug|publisher=Time|date=10 February 2018}} In addition to the athletes, Kim sent an unprecedented high-level delegation including his sister, [[Kim Yo-jong]], and President of the Presidium, [[Kim Yong-nam]], and performers such as the [[Samjiyon Orchestra]].{{cite news |url=https://www.nknews.org/2018/02/delegation-visit-shows-n-korea-can-take-drastic-steps-to-improve-relations-mo|title=Delegation visit shows N. Korea can take "drastic" steps to improve relations: MOU|publisher=NK News|first=Dagyum|last=Ji|date=12 February 2018}} On 5 March, he arranged a meeting with South Korea's Chief of the National Security Office, Chung Eui-yong.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/07/world/asia/kim-jong-un-north-korea.html|title=Kim Jong-un, a Mystery to the World, Surprises in Diplomatic Debut|first=Choe|last=Sang-Hun|date=7 March 2018|accessdate=7 March 2018|work=[[The New York Times]] }} [[Media in China|Chinese media]] announced that [[Kim Jong-un and Xi Jinping's meeting|Kim had visited Beijing]] on 26 March.{{Cite web|url=http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-03/28/c_137070598.htm|title=Xi Jinping, Kim Jong Un hold talks in Beijing - Xinhua {{!}} English.news.cn|website=www.xinhuanet.com|access-date=2018-03-28}}{{Cite news |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/03/27/asia/north-korea-kim-jong-un-china-visit/index.html|title=North Korea's Kim Jong Un met Xi Jinping on surprise visit to China|last=CNN|first=Steven Jiang and Joshua Berlinger,|work=CNN|access-date=2018-03-28}} This was confirmed by the North Korean state press outlet [[Korean Central News Agency]] (KCNA) on 28 March.{{Cite web |url=https://kcnawatch.co/newstream/287683/kim-jong-un-pays-unofficial-visit-to-china/|title=Kim Jong Un Pays Unofficial Visit to China|work=KCNA|access-date=2018-04-02}} At the [[April 2018 inter-Korean summit]], Kim and South Korean President [[Moon Jae-in]] signed the [[Panmunjom Declaration]], pledging to convert the [[Korean Armistice Agreement]] into a full peace treaty, formally ending the [[Korean War]], by the end of the year.{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-koreas-summit-20180426-story.html|title=Kim Jong Un makes historic walk across border to meet South Korea's Moon Jae-in|first=Foster|last=Klug|accessdate=3 May 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-43914208|title=Kim Jong-un crosses into South Korea|date=27 April 2018 |via=www.bbc.com}}{{cite news|title=Koreas make nuclear pledge after summit|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-43921385|accessdate=27 April 2018|work=BBC News|date=27 April 2018}} From 7–8 May, Kim made a second visit to China, meeting with Xi Jinping in [[Dalian]].{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/08/world/asia/kim-jong-un-xi-jinping-china-north-korea.html|title=Kim's Second Surprise Visit to China Heightens Diplomatic Drama|date=8 May 2018|publisher=|accessdate=26 May 2018|via=NYTimes.com}} On 26 May, Kim had a second and unannounced meeting the North Korean side of [[Panmunjom]], meeting with Moon to discuss the summit with Donald Trump.{{cite web |title=Kim Jong Un, South Korea's Moon Meet Amid Uncertainty Over U.S. Summit |date=May 26, 2018 |publisher=The Wall Street Journal |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/kim-jong-un-south-koreas-moon-meet-amid-uncertainty-over-u-s-summit-1527334020}}{{cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/05/26/politics/north-and-south-korean-leaders-meet-again/index.html|title=North and South Korean leaders hold surprise meeting|first=Jungeun Kim and Theresa Waldrop,|last=CNN|publisher=|accessdate=26 May 2018}} On 10 June, Kim arrived in [[Singapore]] and met with Prime Minister [[Lee Hsien Loong]].{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-usa-kim/north-koreas-kim-lands-in-singapore-on-cusp-of-making-history-idUSKBN1J609X|title=Trump upbeat ahead of North Korean summit; Kim visits Singapore sites|first=Steve|last=Holland|website=reuters.com}} On June 12, Kim met Donald Trump for a [[2018 North Korea–United States summit|summit]] and signed a declaration, affirming a commitment to peace and nuclear disarmament.{{cite web |last1=Rosenfeld |first1=Everett |title=Document signed by Trump and Kim includes four main elements related to 'peace regime' |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/06/12/trump-and-kim-sign-agreement-document-after-summit-in-singapore.html |website=CNBC |accessdate=June 12, 2018 |date=June 12, 2018}} In September, Kim held another [[September 2018 inter-Korean summit|summit with Moon]] in Pyongyang. Kim agreed to dismantle North Korea's nuclear weapons facilities if the United States took reciprocal action. The two governments also announced that they would establish buffer zones on their borders to prevent clashes.{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-09-19/north-korea-agrees-to-dismanlte-nuclear-test-site/10282040|title=North Korea agrees to dismantle nuclear complex if United States takes reciprocal action, South says|publisher=ABC|date=19 September 2019}} == Personality == [[Kenji Fujimoto]], a Japanese chef who claims to have worked as Kim Jong-il's personal cook, described Kim Jong-un as "a chip off the old block, a spitting image of his father in terms of face, body shape, and personality".{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/dec/19/kim-jong-un-north-korea-leader |title=Kim Jong‑un, 'great successor' poised to lead North Korea |date=19 December 2011 |work=The Guardian |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150703002350/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/dec/19/kim-jong-un-north-korea-leader |archivedate= 3 July 2015 |dead-url=no |first=Justin |last=McCurry |location=London, UK |issn=0261-3077 |df= }} ''[[The Washington Post]]'' reported in 2009 that Kim Jong-un's school friends recalled he "spent hours doing meticulous pencil drawings of [[Chicago Bulls]] superstar [[Michael Jordan]]".{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/07/15/AR2009071503930_pf.html |title=Who Will Succeed Kim Jong Il? |date=16 July 2009 |work=The Washington Post |archive-url=https://webcitation.org/query?date=2015-12-26&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.washingtonpost.com%2Fwp-dyn%2Fcontent%2Farticle%2F2009%2F07%2F15%2FAR2009071503930_pf.html |archive-date=26 December 2015 |dead-url=no |first=Andrew |last=Higgins |page=A01 |df=dmy-all }} He was obsessed with [[basketball]] and [[computer games]].{{cite news|last1=Freeman |first1=Colin |last2=Sherwell |first2=Philip |title=North Korea leadership: 'My happy days at school with North Korea's future leader' |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/8025015/North-Korea-leadership-My-happy-days-at-school-with-North-Koreas-future-leader.html |accessdate=14 February 2017 |work=The Telegraph |date=26 September 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170214181910/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/8025015/North-Korea-leadership-My-happy-days-at-school-with-North-Koreas-future-leader.html |archivedate=14 February 2017 }}
{{cite news|last1=Fisher |first1=Max |title=Kim Jong Eun inherited an eccentric obsession with basketball from father Kim Jong Il |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2013/03/01/kim-jong-eun-inherited-an-eccentric-obsession-with-basketball-from-father-kim-jong-il/ |accessdate=14 February 2017 |work=The Washington Post |date=1 March 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170214180304/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2013/03/01/kim-jong-eun-inherited-an-eccentric-obsession-with-basketball-from-father-kim-jong-il/ |archivedate=14 February 2017 }} On 26 February 2013, Kim Jong‑un met [[Dennis Rodman]],[http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/dennis-rodman-kim-jong-awesome-guy-article-1.1277017 Dennis Rodman: North Korea's Kim Jong Un is an 'awesome guy,' and his father and grandfather were 'great leaders'] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130304071538/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/dennis-rodman-kim-jong-awesome-guy-article-1.1277017 |date=4 March 2013 }}. ''Daily News''. 1 March 2013. leading many reporters to speculate that Rodman was the first American that Kim had met.{{cite news|publisher=ABC News |title=Rodman Worms His Way into Kim Jong Un Meeting |date=28 February 2013 |url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/headlines/2013/02/rodman-worms-his-way-into-kim-jong-un-meeting |author=Joohee Cho |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Elyg6IRd?url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/headlines/2013/02/rodman-worms-his-way-into-kim-jong-un-meeting/ |archivedate=28 February 2013 |deadurl=yes |df= }} Rodman described his trip to Kim Jong-un's private island, "It's like Hawaii or Ibiza, but he's the only one that lives there."{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/nov/02/dennis-rodman-north-korea-kim-jong-un |title=Dennis Rodman: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is a 'good-hearted kid' |date=2 November 2013 |work=The Guardian |location=London, UK |issn=0261-3077 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161115035810/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/nov/02/dennis-rodman-north-korea-kim-jong-un |archivedate=15 November 2016 }} In July 2012, Kim Jong-un showed a change in cultural policy from his father by attending a [[Moranbong Band]] concert. The concert contained several elements of pop culture from [[Western culture|the West]], particularly the United States. Kim used this event to debut his wife to the public, an unprecedented move in North Korea.Lankov, Andrei (10 April 2013). The Real North Korea: Life and Politics in the Failed Stalinist Utopia (pp. 139–141). Oxford University Press. Kindle Edition. During Dennis Rodman's trip, ''[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]'' magazine correspondent [[Ryan Duffy (correspondent)|Ryan Duffy]] observed that "the leader was 'socially awkward' and didn't make eye contact when shaking hands".{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/vice-tracks-rodman-strange-days-north-korea-article-1.1357860 |title='Vice' season finale on HBO gives fresh look at Dennis Rodman's meeting with North Korea's Kim Jong-un |work=Daily News |location=New York |date=29 May 2013 |accessdate=16 July 2013 |last=Silverman |first=Justin Rocket |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608052205/http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/vice-tracks-rodman-strange-days-north-korea-article-1.1357860 |archivedate=8 June 2013 }} According to Cheong Seong-chang of the [[Sejong Institute]], Kim Jong-un has greater visible interest in the welfare of his people and engages in greater interaction with them than his father did.{{cite news|title=N.K. leader seen moving toward economic reform |url=http://view.koreaherald.com/kh/view.php?ud=20120627001074 |accessdate=28 June 2012 |newspaper=The Korea Herald |date=27 June 2012 |author=Song Sang-ho |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120703021456/http://view.koreaherald.com/kh/view.php?ud=20120627001074 |archivedate=3 July 2012 }} South Koreans who saw Kim at the summit in April 2018 described him as straightforward, humorous, and attentive.{{cite news|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/east-asia/kim-jong-un-uncensored-what-does-footage-say-about-personality-of-reclusive-leader|title=Kim Jong Un uncensored: 7 impressions gleaned from historic summit|publisher=Straits Times|date=1 May 2018}} After meeting him, Donald Trump said, "I learned he was a talented man. I also learned he loves his country very much." He added that Kim had a "great personality" and was "very smart".{{cite news|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/news/politics/2018/06/12/five-things-president-trump-said-about-kim-jong-and-north-korea-that-have-critics-seething/eYd6Ei89ptewuWjQAPr9HN/story.html|title=Five things President Trump said about Kim Jong Un and North Korea that have critics seething|publisher=Boston Globe|first=Jaclyn|last=Reiss|date=12 June 2018}} == Health == In 2009, reports suggested that Kim Jong-un was a [[diabetic]] and suffered from [[hypertension]].{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/06/01/kim-jongun-north-koreas-k_n_210065.html|title=Kim Jong-un: North Korea's Kim Anoints Youngest Son As Heir|work=The Huffington Post|date=2 June 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304074646/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/06/01/kim-jongun-north-koreas-k_n_210065.html|archivedate=4 March 2016}}[http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/dprk/kim-jong-woong.htm Kim Jong-un (Kim Jong Woon) – Leadership Succession] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170225142111/http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/dprk/kim-jong-woong.htm |date=25 February 2017 }}. Global Security.org. 3 July 2009 He is also known to smoke cigarettes.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/06/09/asia/kim-jong-un-smoking/index.html |title=Kim Jong Un caught smoking during anti-smoking drive |last=CNN |first=Chieu Luu |publisher=CNN |accessdate=10 June 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610062926/http://www.cnn.com/2016/06/09/asia/kim-jong-un-smoking/index.html |archivedate=10 June 2016 }} Kim Jong-un did not appear in public for six weeks in September and October 2014. State media reported that he was suffering from an "uncomfortable physical condition". Previously he had been seen limping.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/sep/26/north-korea-kim-jong-un-ill-health |author=Justin McCurry and Enjoli Liston |title=North Korea admits to Kim Jong-un's ill-health for first time |work=The Guardian |location=London, UK |issn=0261-3077 |date=26 September 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170217144641/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/sep/26/north-korea-kim-jong-un-ill-health |archivedate=17 February 2017 }} When he reappeared, he was using a walking stick.{{cite news|last1=Fifield |first1=Anna |title=North Korean media report that Kim Jong Un is back at work |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/north-korean-media-report-that-kim-jong-un-is-back/2014/10/13/b3545c63-0d8e-4edf-b9f5-06321d3da037_story.html |accessdate=13 October 2014 |work=The Washington Post |date=13 October 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141014133600/http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/north-korean-media-report-that-kim-jong-un-is-back/2014/10/13/b3545c63-0d8e-4edf-b9f5-06321d3da037_story.html |archivedate=14 October 2014 }}
{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/10/13/world/asia/north-korea-kim-jong-un/index.html |title=North Korea says leader has reappeared |publisher=CNN |date=13 October 2014 |accessdate=13 October 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141014090047/http://www.cnn.com/2014/10/13/world/asia/north-korea-kim-jong-un/index.html |archivedate=14 October 2014 }} In September 2015, the South Korean government commented that Kim appeared to have gained 30 kg in body fat over the previous five years, reaching a total estimated body weight of {{convert|130|kg|lbs|abbr=on}}.[[Kyodo News]], "Kim has gained 30 kg, weighs 130 now: Seoul", ''[[Japan Times]]'', 28 September 2015, p. 5 == Family == [[File:Chung Eui-yong and Kim Jong-un.jpg|thumb|Kim (right) and his sister [[Kim Yo-jong]] (far right), who is said to be very close to him]] On 25 July 2012, North Korean state media reported for the first time that Kim Jong-un is married to [[Ri Sol-ju]] (리설주).{{cite news|title=North Korea leader Kim Jong-un married to Ri Sol-ju |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18986249 |publisher=BBC |accessdate=25 July 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120725185615/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18986249 |archivedate=25 July 2012 }}{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2012/07/26/north-korea-leader-kim-jong-un-projects-new-image-by-showing-off-wife |title=North Korea leader Kim Jong Un projects new image by showing off wife |agency=Associated Press |publisher=Fox News Channel |date=26 July 2012 |accessdate=26 July 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120726135344/http://www.foxnews.com/world/2012/07/26/north-korea-leader-kim-jong-un-projects-new-image-by-showing-off-wife/ |archivedate=26 July 2012 }} Ri, who was believed to be in her early 20s, had been accompanying Kim Jong-un to public appearances for several weeks prior to the announcement. According to a South Korean analyst, Kim Jong-il had hastily arranged the marriage after suffering a stroke in 2008, the two married in 2009, and they had a child in 2010.{{cite news|title=North Korea leader Kim Jong-un married to Ri Sol-ju |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18986249 |publisher=BBC |date=25 July 2012 |accessdate=4 December 2013 |quote=Ms Ri is believed to have married Mr Kim in 2009 and given birth to a child the following year, analyst Cheong Seong-chang told the South Korean Korea Times newspaper. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131107114949/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18986249 |archivedate=7 November 2013 }} Dennis Rodman, after visiting in 2013, reported that they had a daughter named Ju-ae.{{cite news|url=http://news.nationalpost.com/sports/nba/dennis-rodman-seems-to-let-it-slip-that-kim-jong-un-has-a-daughter |title=Dennis Rodman lets the world know Kim Jong-un has a daughter |agency=Associated Press |work=National Post |issn=1486-8008 |date=19 March 2013 |accessdate=23 March 2013 |df= }}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/sep/09/dennis-rodman-north-korea-baby-name |title=Dennis Rodman gives away name of Kim Jong‑un's daughter |work=The Guardian |date=9 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150909205413/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/sep/09/dennis-rodman-north-korea-baby-name |archive-date= 9 September 2015 |dead-url=no |first=Peter |last=Walker |location=London, UK |issn=0261-3077 |df= }} However, South Korean sources speculated that they could have many children.{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2013/03/20/2013032000553.html |title=Kim Jong-un 'Has a Little Daughter' |work=Chosun |date=20 March 2013 |accessdate=14 April 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130415034023/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2013/03/20/2013032000553.html |archivedate=15 April 2013 }}
[http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2013/05/16/2013051600925.html Kim Jong-un 'Has 2 Daughters'] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130521020307/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2013/05/16/2013051600925.html |date=21 May 2013 }}, Chosun.com, 16 May 2013. Kim is sometimes accompanied by his younger sister Kim Yo-jong, who is said to be instrumental in creating his public image and organising public events for him.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/sister-helps-kim-strut-his-stuff-as-key-missile-test-looms-jjf8gdvzk|title=Sister helps Kim strut his stuff as key missile test looms|last=Sherwell|first=Phillip|date=8 January 2017|newspaper=The Times|access-date=15 February 2017|language=en}} According to Kim Yong-hyun, a professor of North Korean studies at [[Dongguk University]] in Seoul, and others, the promotion of Kim Yo-jong and others is a sign that "the Kim Jong-un regime has ended its co-existence with the remnants of the previous Kim Jong-il regime by carrying out a generational replacement in the party's key elite posts".{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/09/kim-yo-jong-sister-brains-behind-kim-jong-uns-image|title=Meet Kim Yo-jong, the sister who is the brains behind Kim Jong-un's image|last=McCurry|first=Justin|date=2017-10-09|work=The Guardian|access-date=2018-01-08|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5205399/Kim-Jong-uns-sister-sits-yards-promotion.html|title=Kim Jong-un's sister sits just yards from the tyrant after promotion|work=Mail Online|access-date=2018-01-08}} On 13 February 2017, [[Kim Jong-nam]], the exiled half-brother of Kim Jong-un, was assassinated with the [[VX (nerve agent)|nerve agent VX]] while walking through Terminal 2 at [[Kuala Lumpur International Airport]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-39073389 |title=Kim Jong-nam killing: VX nerve agent 'found on his face' |publisher=BBC News |date=24 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224021724/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-39073389 |archivedate=24 February 2017 }} {{Kim Jong-il family}} == See also == {{Portal|North Korea|Politics}} * [[Inter-Korean summit]] * [[Kim dynasty (North Korea)]] * [[Kim Jong-un bibliography]] * [[Residences of North Korean leaders]] * [[2018 North Korea–United States summit]] * [[List of official trips made by Kim Jong-un]] == Notes == {{notelist|group=efn}} == References == {{Reflist}} == Further reading == {{refbegin}} *{{cite book|last=Bechtol|first=Bruce E., Jr.|title=North Korea and Regional Security in the Kim Jong-un Era: A New International Security Dilemma|year=2014|publisher=Palgrave Macmillan|isbn=978-1-137-40007-9}} *{{cite book|title=Kim Jong Un Aphorisms |volume=1|url=http://www.naenara.com.kp/en/book/download.php?4+4061#.pdf |date=2016 |publisher=Foreign Languages Publishing House |location=Pyongyang |isbn=978-9946-0-1430-2}} *{{cite book|last1=Lee|first1=Kyo-Duk|last2=Lim|first2=Soon-Hee|last3=Cho|first3=Jeong-Ah|last4=Song|first4=Joung-Ho|title=Study on the Power Elite of the Kim Jong Un Regime|url=http://repo.kinu.or.kr/bitstream/2015.oak/2240/1/0001458996.pdf|series=Study Series 13-01|year=2013|publisher=Korea Institute for National Unification|location=Seoul|isbn=978-89-8479-708-6}} *{{cite book |editor1=Thak Song-il |editor2=An Su-yong |title=Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in the Year 2012 |url=http://www.naenara.com.kp/en/book/download.php?4+4051#.pdf |date=January 2014 |publisher=Foreign Languages Publishing House |location=Pyongyang |isbn=978-9946-0-1192-9}} *{{cite book |editor=An Chol-gang |title=Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in the Year 2013 |url=http://www.naenara.com.kp/en/book/download.php?4+4056#.pdf |date=November 2014 |publisher=Foreign Languages Publishing House |location=Pyongyang |isbn=978-9946-0-1192-9}} *{{cite book|author1=Thak Son-il|author2=An Su-yong|title=Anecdotes of Kim Jong Un's Life|year=2017|publisher=Foreign Languages Publishing House|location=Pyongyang|isbn=978-9946-0-1530-9}} {{refend}} == External links == {{Wikiquote}} {{Commons category}} * {{Britannica|1549482|Kim Jong-Un}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20101201161408/http://video.nytimes.com/video/2010/09/30/world/asia/1248069113905/north-korea-s-young-leader-on-show.html North Korea's Young Leader on Show] – video report by ''[[The New York Times]]'' * [http://nsarchive.wordpress.com/2011/12/19/document-friday-kim-jong-il-the-%E2%80%9Cgreat-successor%E2%80%9D/ NSA Archive Kim Jong-Il: The "Great Successor"] * [http://www.naenara.com.kp/en/politics/?leader3 Official short biography] at [[Naenara]] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20170729133349/http://www.korean-books.com.kp/en/search/?page=work-leader3 Kim Jong-un's works] at Publications of the DPRK {{s-start}} {{s-ppo}} {{s-bef|before=[[Kim Jong-il]]|rows=3}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea|Chairman]] of the [[Workers' Party of revision.comment: /* top */replaced poptime to population per [[Category:Articles using Template:Infobox ethnic group with deprecated parameters]] using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox ethnic group |group = '''Kluet people'''
'''Kluwat people''' |image = |caption = |population = 53,500{{cite web|url=http://joshuaproject.net/people_groups/10247/ID |title=Kluet in Indonesia |publisher=[[Joshua Project]] |accessdate=2014-10-30}} |popplace = {{flag|Indonesia}} ([[Aceh]]) |langs = [[Alas-Kluet language]], [[Indonesian language]] |rels = [[Islam]] |related = [[Alas people|Alas]], [[Singkil people|Singkil]], [[Pakpak people|Pakpak]] }} '''Kluet''' or '''Kluwat''' people dwell in a number of districts in [[South Aceh Regency]], [[Aceh]], [[Indonesia]] namely North Kluet, South Kluet, Central Kluet and East Kluet. The Kluet people are regarded as part of the [[Batak people]] sub-ethnicity. The Kluet regions are separated by Lawé Kluet River, where it disgorges from the [[Mount Leuser]] and disembogues into the [[Indian Ocean]]. Residential region of the Kluet people is 30 km from [[Tapaktuan]] city or 500 km from [[Banda Aceh]].{{cite book|author1=Ryan Ver Berkmoes |author2=Celeste Brash |author3=Muhammad Cohen |author4=Mark Elliott |author5=Guyan Mitra |author6=John Noble |author7=Adam Skolnick |author8=Iain Stewart |author9=Steve Waters |title=Lonely Planet Indonesia|year=2010|publisher=Lonely Planet|isbn=1-7422-0348-5}} Majority of the population and as well as the Kluet people practices [[Islam]].{{cite book|author=Lesley McCulloch|title=Aceh: Then And Now|year=2005|publisher=Minority Rights Group International|isbn=1-9045-8428-4}} The language spoken by the Kluet people is [[Alas-Kluet language]], which is categorized as part of the [[Batak languages]].{{cite book|author1=Barbara F. Grimes |author2=Joseph Evans Grimes |title=Ethnologue: Languages of the world, Volume 1 of Ethnologue, Summer Institute of Linguistics|year=2000|publisher=SIL International|isbn=1-5567-1103-4}} The Kluet language itself is divided into three dialects, which are the Paya Dapur, Manggamat and Lawe Sawah dialect. During the colonial period, the [[Acehnese people]] are known to have had political influence on the coastal area that became known as Kluet kingdom. Therefore, the [[Acehnese people]] also had cultural influence in the culture of the Kluet people to a certain degree, where the ''adat'' (customary) authority structure of the Kluet people are historically similar.{{cite book|author=John Fitzgerald McCarthy|title=The Fourth Circle: A Political Ecology of Sumatra's Rainforest Frontier|year=2006|publisher=Stanford University Press|isbn=0-8047-5212-5}} Farming is the main source of income for the Kluet people. Just like any other [[Batak people]], the Kluet people have [[Marga (Batak)|marga]] (surnames or family names) of their own that are still being used today:- * Pelis * Selian * Bencawan * Pinem * Caniago These [[Marga (Batak)|margas]] are also found among other [[Batak people]] such as [[Alas people]], [[Karo people (Indonesia)|Karo people]] and [[Pakpak people]]; except for Caniago which are believed to be the descendants of [[Minangkabau people]] that have assimilated with the Kluet people centuries ago. == References == {{reflist}} {{Ethnic groups in Indonesia}} {{Portal|Indonesia}} [[Category:Ethnic groups in Indonesia]] [[Category:Ethnic groups in Sumatra]] [[Category:Ethnic groups in Aceh]] [[Category:Muslim communities of Indonesia]] [[Category:History of Sumatra]] [[Category:Ethnography]] {{Indonesia-stub}}

page.title: List of Muslim Other Backward Classes communities in India

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2015}} This is a full '''list of Muslim communities in India (OBCs)''' that are recognised in [[India]]'s Constitution as [[Other Backward Class|other backward classes]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ncbc.nic.in/backward-classes/index.html|title=National Commission for Backward Classes|publisher=|accessdate=2 February 2015}}</ref> a term used to classify socially and educationally disadvantaged castes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://scroll.in/article/714430/The-Daily-Fix:-Supreme-Court-reminds-India-that-the-third-word-in-OBC-is-'class'-not-'caste|title=The Daily Fix: Supreme Court reminds India that the third word in OBC is 'class' not 'caste'}}</ref>
== Andhra Pradesh & Telangana ==
=== Central list === Below is a list of Muslim communities that have been accorded Other Backward Classes status by the [[Government of India]] in the state of [[Andhra Pradesh & Telangana]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ncbc.nic.in/Pdf/andhrapradesh.pdf|title=National Commission for Backward Classes|publisher=|accessdate=2 February 2015}}</ref> * {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! Entry number !! Caste/community || Resolution no. and date |- | *37 || [[Hela Mehtar|Mehtar]]|| 12011/68/93-BCC(C ) dt. 10 September 1993 and 12011/9/2004-BCC dt. 16 January 2006 |- | *43 ||Dudekula Laddaf, Pinjari or Noorbash (Muslim) || 12011/68/93-BCC(C ) dt. 10 September 1993 |- | *62 || Arekatika, Katika, Quresh (Muslim butchers) || 12011/68/93-BCC(C ) dt. 10 September 1993 and 12011/4/2002-BCC dt. 13 January 2004 |-
| *33 || (Muslim butchers) || 12011/68/93-BCC(C ) dt. 10 September 93 and 12011/4/2002-BCC dt. 13 January 2004 |- |}
=== State list === Below is a list of Muslim communities that have been accorded Other Backward Classes status by the [[Government of Andhra Pradesh]] & [[Government of Telangana|Telangana]] and [[Government of Karnataka|Karnataka]] state government.<ref>http://www.aponline.gov.in/apportal/departments/departments.asp?dep=03&org=111&category=Introduction {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100923184205/http://www.aponline.gov.in/apportal/departments/departments.asp?dep=03&org=111&category=Introduction |date=23 September 2010 }}</ref>
* 1. Achchukattalavandlu, Singali, Singamvallu, Achchupanivallu, Achchukattuvaru, Achukatlavandlu. * 2. Attar Saibulu, Attarollu * 3. [[Muslim Dhobi|Dhobi Muslim]] / Muslim Dhobi / Dhobi Musalman, Turka Chakla or Turka Sakala, Turaka Chakali, Tulukka Vannan, Tsakalas, Sakalas or Chakalas, Muslim Rajakas * 4. [[Faqir (caste)|Faqir]], Fhakir Budbudki, Ghanti Fhakir, Ghanta Fhakirlu, Turaka Budbudki, Darvesh, Fakeer * 5. Garadi Muslim, Garadi Saibulu, Pamulavallu, Kani-kattuvallu, Garadollu, Garadiga * 6. Gosangi Muslim, Phakeer Sayebulu * 7. Guddi Eluguvallu, Elugu Bantuvallu, Musalman Keelu Gurralavallu * 8. [[Hajjam]], Nai, Nai Muslim, Navid * 9. Labbi, [[Labbai]], Labbon, Labba * 10. Pakeerla, Borewale, Deera Phakirlu, Bonthala * 11. [[Qassab|Qureshi / Qassab]], Kureshi / Khureshi, Khasab, Marati Khasab, Muslim Katika, Khatik Muslim * 12. [[Siddi]], Yaba, Habshi, Jasi * 13. Turaka Kasha, Kakkukotte Zinka Saibulu, Chakkitakanevale, Terugadu Gontalavaru, Thirugatigantla, Rollaku Kakku Kottevaru, Pattar Phodulu, Chakketakare, Thuraka Kasha * 14. Other Muslim groups, excluding ** [[Mughal (tribe)|Mughal]], Moghal ** Vip ** Irani ** Bohara, [[Mustaali|Bohra]] ** [[Kutchi Memon|Cutchi-Memon]] ** [[Konkani Muslims|Jamayat]] ** [[Navayath]]
== [[Assam]] == * 1. [[Maimal]] * 2. [[Muslims of Manipur|Pangal]] * 3. Maimal (Saikh) * 4. Jolha * 5. Maria (M-0BC)

Notes:
*<sup>1</sup> Only the [[Darzi]] community are Muslims. *<sup>2</sup> Only Muslim Dhobis are in the OBC list; the Hindu section have Scheduled Caste status. *<sup>3</sup> Mansoori is the preferred self-designation for the Dhunia community *<sup>4</sup> Only the Gaddi community are Muslims. *<sup>5</sup> Only the Ghosi community are Muslims. *<sup>6</sup> largely Hindu community with a small Muslim minority *<sup>7</sup> largely Hindu community with a small Muslim minority *<sup>8</sup> largely Hindu community with a small Muslim minority *<sup>9</sup> partly Hindu and partly Muslim community *<sup>10</sup> The Saifi are Muslim Lohars. *<sup>11</sup> largely Muslim community with a small Hindu minority *<sup>12</sup> largely Muslim community with a small Hindu minority *<sup>13</sup> Only Muslim Mochis are in the OBC list; the Hindu section have Scheduled Caste status. *<sup>13</sup> largely Hindu community with a small Muslim minority *<sup>14</sup> The Teli Maliks are Muslims.

Explanation: In the above list for the State of Rajasthan, all castes, which are known by the name of their respective traditional hereditary occupations and whose members follow different religions, include all members of those castes, irrespective of whether they follow the [[Hindu]] religion or [[Islam]] or any other religion (Vide Resolution No. 12011/4/2002-BCC dt. 19 June 2003).

Explanation: In the above list for Uttar Pradesh for all castes linked with traditional hereditary occupations, except those entered with specific mention of name of religion, are included, irrespective of whether their members follow Hinduism, Islam or any other religion. *<sup>23</sup> the Mansoori are Muslim Dhunai.

== References == {{reflist}} {{Indian Muslim}}
[[Category:Ethnic groups in India| ]] [[Category:Social groups of India]] [[Category:Muslim communities of India|*]] [[Category:Dalit Muslim|*]] [[Category:Lists of Indian people by community|Muslim Other Backward Classes]] [[Category:Other Backward Classes]]

{{pp-semi|small=yes}} Telugu society is nowadays{{Weasel inline|date=October 2018}} officially classified into a number of groups, some of which{{Clarify|reason=vague terms, needs citations|date=October 2018}} align with the concept of [[caste]].
== Forward Classes == [[Forward caste]]s do not qualify for government reservations. Those present in [[Andhra Pradesh]] are:<ref>{{cite web |title=Caste, Class and Social Articulation in Andhra Pradesh: Mapping Differential Regional Trajectories |page=12 |url=http://www.odi.org.uk/sites/odi.org.uk/files/odi-assets/publications-opinion-files/2692.pdf |first=K. |last=Srinivasulu |publisher=Overseas Development Institute}}</ref><ref>{{citation |last=Vaugier-Chatterjee |first=Anne |chapter=Two Dominant Castes: The Socio-political System in Andhra Pradesh |editor1-last=Jaffrelot |editor1-first=Christophe |editor2-last=Kumar |editor2-first=Sanjay |title=Rise of the Plebeians?: The Changing Face of the Indian Legislative Assemblies |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=78rfCgAAQBAJ&pg=PA280 |year=2012 |publisher=Routledge |isbn=978-1-136-51662-7 |pages=280}}</ref> *[[Telugu Brahmins|Brahmin]] *[[Kamma (caste)|Kamma]] *[[Kapu (caste)|Kapu]] *[[Komati caste|Komati]] *[[Kshatriya]]<!--THE SOURCE DOES NOT SAY RAJU, JUST AS OUR ARTICLE FOR RAJU DOES NOT--> *[[Reddy]] *[[Velama (caste)|Velama]] *[[balija |balija]]
Some communities within these groups are instead classified under other categories, as noted below.
== Backward Classes ==
Some communities are classified as [[Other Backward Classes]] due to social, financial, educational, and/or political discrimination.<ref>{{cite web |title=Central List Of Other Backward Classes |url=http://ncbc.nic.in/User_Panel/GazetteResolution.aspx?Value=mPICjsL1aLvYBtdZSrP4uO%2bploAhiJHMitEMCkgxxsH%2f7oa9L5Zf2o2HH3BmrgcE}}</ref>
*Agnikulakshatriya Palli Vadabalija Bestha Jalari Gangavar Gangaputra Goondla Vanyakulakshtriya Vannekapu Vannereddi Pallikapu Pallireddi Nayyala Pattapu *Balasanthu, Bahurupi *Bandara *Budabukkala *Rajaka, Chakali, Vannar *Dasari (formerly engaged in Bhikshatana) *Dommara *Gangiredlavaru *Jangam whose traditional occupation is begging *Jogi *Katipapala *Korcha, Koracha *Medari or Mahendra *Mondivaru Mondibanda Banda *Nayi-Brahmin (Mangali, Mangala, Bhajanthri) *Vamsha Raj *Pamula *Pardhi (Mirshikari, Nirshikari ) *Pambala *Peddammavandlu, Devaravandlu, Yellammavandlu, Mutyalammavandlu *Veeramushti (Neetikotala), Veerabhadreeya *Valmiki Boya (Boya Bedar, Kirataka Nishadi, Yellappi, Yellapu/Yellapondlu, Pedda Boya ) Talayari, Chunduvallu *Gudala *Kanjara-Bhatta *Kinthala Kalinga, Buragana Kalinga, Buragam Kalinga, Pandiri Kalinga, [[Kalinga_(caste)|Kalinga]] *Kepmare or Reddika *Mondepatta Mondipatta *Nokkar *Pariki Muggula *Yata *Chopemari *Kaikadi *Joshinandiwala *Odde *Mudiraj, Mutrasi Tenugollu *Munnurukapu (Telangana) *Nagavasam (Nagavamsa) *Neeli (Nelli) *Pollinativelama (of Srikakulam & Visakhapatnam Districts) *Poosala *Passi *Rangarez or Bhavasara Kshatriya traditionally associated with selling of Bangles) *Vannia Vanniar Vannikula-Kshatriya *Sarollu *Atirasa (of Polavaram, Gopalapuram, Koyyalagudem, Buttayagudem, Chagallu Mandals of [[West Godavari district]] and Devipattanam, Korukonda and Gokavaram Mandals of East Godavari District) *Patra *Sikligar *Siddula *Gudia/Gudiya (confined to Srikakulam, Vizianagaram and Visakhapatnam Districts only) *Kurmi (confined to Telangana Region and also Krishna District only) *Budubunjala/ Bhunjwa/ Bhadbhunja (confined to Hyderabad and Ranga Reddy Districts only) *Lakkamari Kapu (confined to Telangana Region only)
== See also == *[[Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes]] *[[List of Scheduled Tribes in India#Andhra Pradesh]]

page.title: List of disasters in Great Britain and Ireland by death toll

revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=December 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} The following '''list of disasters in Great Britain and Ireland''' is a list of major [[disaster]]s (excluding acts of war but including acts of [[terrorism]]) which relate to the [[United Kingdom]] since 1801, or the states that preceded it ([[Kingdom of England|England and Wales]] and [[Kingdom of Scotland|Scotland]] before 1707, [[Kingdom of Ireland|Ireland]] and [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Great Britain]] from 1707 to 1800), or involved their citizens, in a definable [[Incident management|incident]] or [[accident]] such as a [[shipwreck]], where the loss of life was forty or more. == Over 200 fatalities == {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:90%;" ! data-sort-type="number"|Deaths
''Italics'' indicate an
estimated figure
!! Event !! Year !! Notes |- | ''3,500,000'' || [[Black Death]] [[pandemic]] || 1347–1350 ||See discussion of death toll estimates at [[Black Death in England#Death toll]]. |- | ''1,000,000{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/british/victorians/famine_01.shtml|title=The Irish Famine |publisher=[[BBC]] |year=2011 |author=Jim Donnelly}} to 1,500,000'' || [[Great Famine (Ireland)|Great Irish Famine]] || 1845–1849 || See discussion of death toll estimates at [[Great Famine (Ireland)#Death toll]]. |- | ''300,000 to 480,000''Sir William Wilde, "Table of Cosmical Phenomena," pp. 124-32; Dickson, "The other great famine," in Cathal Póirtéir, (ed.) ''The Great Irish Famine'' (1955), Mercier Press, pp. 53-55; and David Dickson, "The gap in famines: a useful myth?", in E. Margaret Crawford (ed.), ''Famine: the Irish experience'', Edinburgh: John Donald, 1989, pp. 97-98 || [[Great Irish Famine (1740–1741)|Great Irish Famine of 1740-41 (The Great Frost)]] || 1740–1741 || Some estimates indicate a death toll as high as 500,000 from starvation and disease.{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.ie/irish-news/our-cold-snap-was-nothing-compared-to-the-great-irish-frost-of-1740-26609822.html|title=Our cold snap was nothing compared to the Great Irish Frost of 1740|website=independent.ie|accessdate=1 April 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.irishtimes.com/news/the-great-frost-and-forgotten-famine-1.282539|title=The Great Frost and Forgotten Famine|website=irishtimes.com|accessdate=1 April 2018}} |- | ''250,000'' || [[Spanish flu]] pandemic || 1918 (Sep–Nov) || An estimated 200,000 people died in England and Wales."British Influenza Epidemic of 1918–19" in ''Encyclopedia of Plague and Pestilence: From Ancient Times to the Present'' (3rd ed. 2008: ed. George Childs Kohn), Infobase, p. 46. Although the official number of deaths in Scotland due to the pandemic is 17,575, a modern estimate of total pandemic mortality in Scotland is between 27,641 and 33,771.Niall P.A.S. Johnson, [http://www.euppublishing.com/doi/abs/10.3366/shr.2004.83.2.216?journalCode=shr Scottish flu – The Scottish Experience of 'Spanish Flu'], ''Scottish Historical Review'', Jan 2008, vol. 83, No. 2, pp. 216–226. About 20,000 died in Ireland.Michael B. A. Oldstone, ''Viruses, Plagues, and History'', Oxford University Press, 1998, p. 174. |- | ''75,000+''http://ocp.hul.harvard.edu/contagion/plague.html || [[Great Plague of London]] || 1665-1666 || |- | ''65,000'' || [[Year Without a Summer]] || 1816 || Famine and [[typhoid fever]] in Ireland[[Bill Bryson]]; ''A Short History...'';'''p 372'''; {{ISBN|0-385-40818-8}} and food riots in England and France, caused by the [[1815 eruption of Mount Tambora]] affecting the weather. |- | ''20,000'' Estimate of mortality in England. || [[Laki#1783 eruption|Laki volcano fissure eruption]] || 1783–1784 (Jun–Feb) || |- | ''8,000'' || [[Great Storm of 1703]] || 1703 (26 November) || |- | ''5,000+'' || [[Great Famine of 1315–1317|Great Famine (14th century)]] || 1315–1317 || |- | {{nowrap|''4,000 to 12,000''}} || [[Great Smog of London]] || 1952 (December) || |- | ''4,000+'' || [[Blockade of Porto Bello]] || 1726–1727 || Deaths resulting from [[yellow fever]]. |- | ''3,500+'' || [[1782 Central Atlantic hurricane]] || 1782 (16–17 Sep) || Loss of [[HMS Ramillies (1763)|HMS ''Ramillies'']], [[HMS Centaur (1759)|HMS ''Centaur'']]; storeships ''Dutton'' and ''British Queen''; captured French prize ships [[French ship Ville de Paris (1764)|''Ville de Paris'']], ''[[HMS Glorieux|Glorieux]]'', ''Hector'' and ''Caton''; plus other [[wikt:merchantmen|merchantmen]]. |- | ''3,000'' || [[Early fires of London#The Great Fire of 1212|1212 Great Fire of London]] || 1212 (July) || Source for fatalities is the ''[[Guinness Book of Records]]'',"In July 1212, 3,000 were killed in the crush, burned or drowned when London Bridge caught fire at both ends". (p.184) {{cite book | title = Guinness Book of Records | author = Norris McWhirter and Ross McWhirter | year = 1971 | publisher = Guinness Superlatives Limited | isbn = 0-900424-05-2 }} but historical evidence unclear. |- | ''2,500+'' || [[Tainted blood scandal (United Kingdom)|Tainted blood scandal]] || 1970s–1980s (deaths up to decades later)http://www.taintedblood.info/background.php {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151203105923/http://www.taintedblood.info/background.php |date=3 December 2015 }} accessed 01/09/2015 ||Importing and use of blood products known to be contaminated with HIV, Hepatitis B & C. People continue to die up to the present time.https://www.taintedblood.info/tb/online-memorial/ |- | ''2,139'' Difference between the number of deaths in that period and the average number in other years. || [[2003 European heat wave#United Kingdom|2003 European heat wave]] || 2003 (4–13 August) || |- | ''2,000'' || [[Bristol Channel floods, 1607|Bristol Channel floods]] || 1607 (30 January)[[Old Style and New Style dates|New style]] dating. || |- | ''2,000'' ||style="white-space: nowrap"| [[Sweating sickness|Sweating sickness {{Smaller|(''sudor anglicus'')}}]] || 1485 ff. || |- | ''1,900+'' || Christmas Eve storm || 1811 (24 December) || Wrecks [[HMS St George (1785)|HMS ''St George'']], [[HMS Defence (1763)|HMS ''Defence'']] and [[HMS Fancy|HMS ''Fancy'']] off [[Thorsminde]], [[Jutland]]; and [[HMS Hero (1803)|HMS ''Hero'']] and [[HMS Archimedes|HMS ''Archimedes'']] off [[Texel]], [[Netherlands]]. |- | ''1,550+'' || [[Scilly naval disaster of 1707|Scilly naval disaster]] || 1707 (22 October) || [[HMS Association|HMS ''Association'']], [[HMS Eagle (1679)|HMS ''Eagle'']], [[HMS Romney (1694)|HMS ''Romney'']] and [[HMS Firebrand (1694)|HMS ''Firebrand'']]. |- | ''1,500+'' || [[RMS Titanic|RMS ''Titanic'']] || 1912 (15 April) || Estimates vary but most official sources and historians put the death toll at upwards of 1500. |- | ''1,200'' || [[Strait of Gibraltar]] storm || 1694 (1 March) || Wrecks [[HMS Sussex (1693)|HMS ''Sussex'']] and accompanying ships. |- | ''1,198'' || [[RMS Lusitania]] || 1915 (7 May)|| Struck by torpedo on starboard side. Sank in the [[Celtic Sea]] within 18 minutes |- | ''1,012'' || [[RMS Empress of Ireland|RMS ''Empress of Ireland'']] || 1914 (29 May) || Ship registered in London, crew almost entirely from Merseyside. |- | ''1,000'' || [[1867 San Narciso hurricane|1867 Barbados hurricane]] || 1867 || [[RMS Rhone|RMS ''Rhone'']], [[RMS Wye|RMS ''Wye'']] and up to 50 other vessels driven ashore.Marshall, Logan, ''Sinking of the Titanic and Great Disasters of the Sea'', 1912. |- | ''1,000'' || [[Great Hurricane of 1780]] || 1780 (10 October) || [[Royal Navy]] ships lost included [[HMS Stirling Castle (1775)|HMS ''Stirling Castle'']], [[HMS Laurel (1779)|HMS ''Laurel'']], [[HMS Andromeda (1777)|HMS ''Andromeda'']], [[HMS Thunderer (1760)|HMS ''Thunderer'']] and [[HMS Phoenix (1759)|HMS
